Sludge Remover can also be added to the pond filter to prevent clogging by breaking down organic material. This product is particularly suitable for natural down flow filters with lava or substrate.

name: Takazumi Sakan-Ni Pro 2.5ltr
description_text:
SAKAN-NI Pro is a mix of herbs, minerals, amino acids, fatty acids, carbohydrates, vitamins, enzymes and probiotic bacteria that will significantly strengthen the immune system of your fish to support your fish during or after injuries and periods of stress and diseases.

  • Increases resistance and strengthens the immune system
  • Detoxifies the body (removes toxic substances)
  • Purifies the blood
  • Stimulates the cleansing effect of the liver and removes toxic substances, pesticides,  medicines and heavy metals from the body
  • Ensures a strong and healthy mucous membrane 
  • Increases the production of B – lymphocytes 
  • Stimulates the production of T-lymphocytes

name: NT Labs Permanganate Dip 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Permanganate Dip - Treatment for Fish Lice, Leeches, Parasites, and Ulcers

When to Use: The NT Labs Permanganate Dip is suitable for treating fish lice, leeches, parasites, and ulcers in pond fish. Use it when fish exhibit visible external parasites or signs of parasitic infection such as flicking, rubbing, or gasping. It can be employed as a whole pond treatment for parasitic infections like Costia, Trichodina, Chilodonella, etc., or as a dip treatment in a separate volume of water for fish lice, leeches, and ulcer cleaning.

How to Use:

  1. Test Water Quality: Use NT Labs Test Kits to assess water quality.
  2. Whole Pond Treatment:
    • Mix the appropriate dosage in a clean bucket of pond water.
    • Pour evenly over the pond surface.
    • Switch off UV filtration until the pink color disappears.
    • Aerate the pond well during treatment.
    • After 7 days, perform a partial water change before using a different medication.
  3. Dip Treatment for Fish:
    • Add the appropriate dosage to a bucket of clean pond water.
    • Gently submerge fish.
    • Provide additional aeration during the dip.
    • Leave fish in the dip for no more than 30 minutes.
    • If a repeat dose is needed, check the diagnosis using the Diagnosis Tool.
  4. Observation and Action:
    • Treat when you can observe fish and take necessary action in case of adverse reactions.

Warnings:

  • Do not use with orfe, rudd, tench, or sturgeon/sterlet.
  • Avoid use if water temperature exceeds 22°C.
  • Do not use in hot, humid, thundery weather.
  • Do not leave fish unattended during dip treatments.
  • Limit dip treatment duration to a maximum of 30 minutes.
  • Do not mix medications.

Note: The Permanganate Dip is a versatile treatment option for various external issues in pond fish. Adhering to the provided instructions and warnings ensures effective and safe application for the well-being of the fish.

name: NT Labs Ulcer Swab 100ml
description_text:
NT Labs Ulcer Swab

When to use? Use Ulcer Swab when your fish have open wounds and ulcers, as these can easily become infected with bacteria or fungus. Ulcer Swab is designed to clean and disinfect wounds and sores, preparing them for further treatment.

How to use:

  1. Ensure you have the appropriate equipment ready before catching the injured fish. This should include a container large enough to hold the fish during treatment. Provide additional aeration during treatment.
  2. Place the fish on a damp towel or another soft, wet surface.
  3. Dry the wound and apply Ulcer Swab liberally to the affected area.
  4. For best results, use Ulcer Swab in conjunction with Koi Calm and Propolis Wound Seal.
  5. Treat the pond with Acriflavin to reduce the numbers of pathogenic bacteria and minimize the likelihood of re-infection.
  6. Feed your fish Medikoi Health and Medikoi Probiotic to aid their recovery by providing vital nourishment and high-quality nutrition.
  7. Test your water quality regularly using NT Labs Test Kits.

Warning:

  • Do not leave fish unattended during treatment.
  • Do not use Ulcer Swab near the eyes or gills.

name: NT Labs KH - Buffer Up 5kg
description_text:
NT Labs KH Buffer Up - Carbonate Hardness (KH) Booster

When to Use: NT Labs KH Buffer Up is recommended when there is a need to increase the carbonate hardness (KH) of pond water. Pond fish require a safe and stable pH to maintain optimal health. Over time, as pond water ages and fish waste along with other organic matter accumulates, it can deplete the carbonate hardness (KH) responsible for providing a safe and stable pH. Insufficient KH levels can lead to unstable water quality, a sudden drop in pH, and potential illness in fish.

How to Use:

  1. Dosage Preparation:

    • Dissolve the powder in a bucket of pond water before adding it to the pond.

  2. Application:

    • Add the dissolved solution to the pond.

  3. Safety Measures:

    • Keep the product out of the reach of children.
    • Wash hands thoroughly after handling fish and the product.

  4. KH Monitoring:

    • Use NT Labs Hardness Test Kit to measure the KH of the pond water.

  5. Optimal KH Level:

    • Maintain the KH above 6 °dH for optimal water quality.

  6. Tap Water Adjustment:

    • KH – Buffer Up can be used to supplement carbonate hardness in cases where tap water is naturally low in hardness minerals.

Note:

  • Regular monitoring of KH levels is advisable to ensure that the carbonate hardness remains within the desired range for the well-being of pond life.

Always follow the recommended dosage and guidelines for optimal results.

name: NT Labs Chlorimine T 50g
description_text:
NT Labs Chloramine T – Your Solution for Treating External Bacterial and Parasitic Infections in Pond Fish

When to Use: NT Labs Chloramine T is the go-to treatment when your fish show symptoms of external bacterial infections such as ulcers, fin, tail, or mouth rot, loose scales, or parasitic infections including Costia, Trichodina, skin or gill flukes. Look out for signs like fish flicking, rubbing against rough surfaces, or gasping.

How to Use:

  1. Test Water Quality:

    • Start by testing your water quality using NT Labs Test Kits to ensure accurate diagnosis and treatment.

  2. Mix Dosage in Bucket:

    • In a clean bucket of pond water, mix the appropriate dosage of Chloramine T.

  3. Evenly Distribute Over Pond Surface:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly over the surface of the pond.

  4. Switch Off UV Filtration:

    • Turn off UV filtration until 48 hours after adding the final dose.

  5. Aerate Pond Well:

    • Ensure good pond aeration during the treatment period.

  6. Add Filter Bugs After 48 Hours:

    • Add Filter Bugs 48 hours after the final dose to boost the biological filtration in your pond.

  7. Repeat Dose or Different Medication:

    • If a repeat dose is needed, use the Diagnosis Tool to check your diagnosis. A different medication may be more suitable. Wait 10 days after the final dose, perform a partial water change before re-treating or treating with a different medication.

  8. Observe Fish and Take Action:

    • Always treat when you have time to observe fish and take appropriate action in the unlikely event of a bad reaction.

Warning:

  • Do not use with orfe, rudd, tench, or sturgeon/sterlet.
  • Wear disposable vinyl or latex gloves and appropriate eye protection when handling this product.
  • Do not use if the pH is below 7, the carbonate hardness (KH) is below 6°dH, and/or the general hardness (GH) is below 6°dH.
  • Do not use in bright sunlight or in hot, humid, thundery conditions.
  • Do not use if the water temperature is below 10°C.
  • Do not store in a hot place.
  • Do not mix medications.

Trust NT Labs Chloramine T for effective treatment of external bacterial and parasitic infections in your pond fish. Follow the provided instructions and safety guidelines for a successful treatment experience. Count on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: NT Labs Chlor-GO 250ml
description_text:
NT Labs Chlor-Go – Your Essential Solution for Making Tap Water Safe for Fish

When to Use: NT Labs Chlor-Go is a must-have when filling or topping up your pond with tap water. Tap water contains chemicals such as chlorine, chloramine, and heavy metals that can be harmful to fish. These need to be neutralized for the water to be safe for your fish. Chlor-Go is the rapid and effective solution to turn tap water into fish-safe pond water. It should be used for all water changes and can also be employed during the transport of new or existing fish stocks.

How to Use:

  1. Dosage for Pond Volume:

    • Use the appropriate dosage for the entire volume of your pond when regularly topping up an established pond.

  2. Mix in Small Volume of Water:

    • Add the recommended dosage to a small volume of water and mix thoroughly.

  3. Split Dosage During Top-Up:

    • Add half of the mixed solution before filling the pond and the other half during the top-up process.

Usage Tips:

  • Regularly use Chlor-Go when topping up your pond to maintain fish-safe water.
  • Consider using Chlor-Go during the transport of new or existing fish stocks to ensure their well-being.

Trust NT Labs Chlor-Go for rapid and reliable neutralization of harmful chemicals in tap water, making it safe for your pond fish. Its easy-to-use formulation ensures that your water changes are stress-free for your fish. Count on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: NT Labs Anti-Parasite & Fungus 1ltr
description_text:
NT Labs Anti-Parasite & Fungus, also known as Eradick – Your Solution for Treating Fish Parasitic and Fungal Infections

When to Use: NT Labs Anti-Parasite & Fungus, or Eradick, is designed for a five-day treatment course when fish exhibit symptoms of parasitic infection. Look for signs such as irritation, flicking, gasping at the surface, the presence of thick opaque mucus, or visible white spots on the body. Additionally, Eradick is effective when fish display fungal infections, characterized by cotton wool-like growths on the body. It can also be used preventatively in early spring.

How to Use:

  1. Shake Well:

    • Before use, shake the Eradick bottle well to ensure an even distribution of the active ingredients.

  2. Mix Correct Dose:

    • In a clean bucket of pond water, mix the correct dosage of Eradick according to the instructions provided.

  3. Evenly Distribute Around Pond:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly around the pond to ensure uniform treatment.

  4. Switch Off UV for 10 Days:

    • Turn off UV filtration for 10 days from the first Eradick dose to allow the treatment to take effect.

  5. Wait 10 Days After Final Dose:

    • After completing the five-day course, wait an additional 10 days before repeating the treatment or applying another medication.

  6. Observation and Caution:

    • Allow ample time to observe the fish during treatment. In the unlikely event of a reaction, take appropriate action.

Usage Tips:

  • Do not use Eradick when the water temperature is above 30°C.
  • Avoid application in hot, humid, or thundery weather.
  • Refrain from mixing Eradick with other medications for optimal efficacy.

Warning:

  • Eradick should not be used in conjunction with water temperatures above 30°C.
  • Avoid application in hot, humid, or thundery weather.
  • Do not mix Eradick with other medications.

Trust NT Labs Anti-Parasite & Fungus (Eradick) to effectively treat and prevent parasitic and fungal infections in your pond. Its comprehensive formula and easy application make it a valuable component of your fish care routine. Rely on NT Labs for reliable solutions in fish health management.

name: NT Labs Acriflavin 2.5 litre
description_text:
NT Labs Acriflavin - Your Solution for Fish Bacterial Infections and Wound Care

Ensure the health and well-being of your Koi with NT Labs Acriflavin, a trusted remedy designed to effectively treat fin, tail, and mouth rot, as well as ulcers in your fish.

When to Use: Utilize Acriflavin when your fish display symptoms of a bacterial infection, or as a proactive quarantine solution before introducing new fish to your aquatic environment. This versatile solution can be combined with Ulcer Swab and Propolis Wound Seal for comprehensive treatment of ulcers and other open wounds.

How to Use: Maintain the optimal water quality using NT Labs Test Kits before beginning treatment. Mix the appropriate dosage in a clean bucket of pond water, then evenly distribute it over the pond's surface. Allow the solution to work its magic for a period of 7 days, remembering to turn off UV filtration until the water color returns to normal. Ensure proper aeration throughout the treatment duration.

If a repeat dosage is deemed necessary, consult the NT Labs Diagnosis Tool to confirm the condition, as a different medication may be more suitable. After medicating, wait for 7 days, perform a partial water change, and then re-treat or switch to a different medication if needed. Always schedule treatments when you have time to observe your fish and respond promptly to any unexpected reactions.

Warning:

  • Do not use Acriflavin at water temperatures exceeding 30°C.
  • Avoid application in hot, humid, or thundery weather.
  • Never mix medications to ensure the effectiveness of the treatment.

Active Ingredients: Acriflavine neutral 80 mg/100ml

Choose NT Labs Acriflavin for a reliable and proven solution to bacterial infections and wounds in your aquarium. Trust in NT Labs to safeguard the health of your Koi.

name: Colombo BiOx (prevents blanket weed) 1000ml
description_text:
Colombo Biox Blanket Weed Controller works naturally by providing activated oxygen which stimulates the biological processes in the pond water resulting in a healthier environment for fish and plants.

  • 1.000 ML = 32.000 ltr
  • 2.500 ML = 80.000 ltr
  • 5.000 ML = 160.000 ltr

name: Pond Medic Acriflavin 500ml
description_text:
Pond Medic Acriflavin is used to treat bacterial and fungal infections in fish. It can be effective against a range of common fish diseases, including fin rot, mouth rot, and external bacterial and fungal infections.

Acriflavin works by interfering with the metabolism and growth of bacteria and fungi. It disrupts their cellular processes, inhibiting their ability to reproduce and causing their eventual death.

The treatment involves adding the recommended dosage of the medication directly to the water in the pond or aquarium.

While Acriflavin is generally considered safe for fish when used as directed, it is essential to follow the recommended dosage and treatment guidelines. Overdosing can be harmful to fish, particularly sensitive species. Additionally, Acriflavin may stain the water yellow, but this is temporary and will usually dissipate over time.

name: Microbe Lift Barley straw extract 250ml
description_text:
Microbe Lift Barley straw extract is a Liquid Extract of Barley Straw Especially Helpful Where Bottom Drains Are Present An environmentally responsible, cost-efficient pond conditioner that is a clean & easy, natural & organic approach to a healthy pond environment. works by binding excessive nutrients that exist in natural ponds as a result of organic waste by-products. For centuries, barley straw has been used to bind nutrients and assist in maintaining clear water.

  • Goes to work on contact.
  • Releases decomposition by-products immediately.
  • Not harmful to aquatic life, plants, humans and pets.
  • One bottle is equal to a multiple of barley straw bales.
  • Can be used all year round.
  • No messy residual.

name: Kusuri Powder Gold 8kg (Treats 35200gallons)
description_text:
A powder treatment that can be used at all temperatures to eradicate string algae and blanketweed.

Use 50g of Powder Gold to 1,000 litres (220 gallons) of pond water. DO NOT OVERDOSE.

1 kg treats 20,000 litres (4,400 gallons) 0.75% w/w Monolinuron, 99.25% Calcium Montmorillonite Clay.

All sizes of Kusuri Powder Gold include a handy dose cup. One level dose cup holds 19.5g of Kusuri Powder Gold. 

Fill a clean watering can with approximately 10 litres (2 gallon) of pond water. Add correct dosage. Stir well and distribute evenly over the surface of the pond. If present, switch off UV clarifier for up to seven days after treatment for maximum effect and remove any decaying blanketweed in subsequent days as the Powder Gold takes effect.

name: Bacto-Plus 2.5ltr
description_text:
Bactoplus Professional Pond Bacteria
Fish produce ammonia around the clock, this is released when
absorbing oxygen through the gills. Ammonia is formed in a toxic form
when the pH is above 7,4. In a biological filter bacteria convert
ammonia via nitrite into nitrate. For this conversion two kinds of
bacteria are needed. The first group converts ammonia into nitrites,
these bacteria are also called ‚‚¹AOB‚‚¾‚. The second group converts
nitrite into nitrate, these bacteria are also called ‚‚¹NOB‚‚¾‚.
Both processes take place with the use of oxygen; hence it is
important that the water flowing through the filter is rich in oxygen.
BactoPlus Filter Starter (gel) contains both AOB and NOB and in high
quantities. During production 800 million bacteria per ml. are added
to the products. Use these products when starting a new filter, after
maintenance andwhen having problems with the water quality. When
the filter is easy to access and the filter media can be set dry,
the Gel version of the product can be applied directly to the filter
media, which is enhancing the effect.

name: ACTIVE BIO-MIX 2ltr
description_text:
Active Mix Bio is a combination of substances including photosynthetic and lactic acid bacteria, yeasts and
trace elements. This combination has a positive impact on the natural balance and biological life resulting in
a perfect equilibrium. It also strongly promotes the biological conversion of ammonia and nitrites into nitrates.
The fact that this mix is already in an activated state means it has a direct and rapid effect on your pond.
Photosynthetic bacteria:
Produce substances that promote the growth of micro-organisms,
especially heterotrophic bacteria. During conversion they produce valuable
substances from organic waste and harmful matter in the water.
Photosynthetic bacteria also compete with algae for nutrients and
sunlight. In the case of algae, light is absorbed by chlorophyll, just like with
regular plants. However, with photosynthetic bacteria, photosynthesis takes
place directly in the cell. Consequently, this provides the additional benefit of
reducing algae growth.
Lactic acid bacteria:
Suppresses pathogenic germs and other harmful micro-organisms and
promote a rapid degradation of organic material (waste substances).
Other additives in the Active Mix Bio (e.g. yeasts and trace elements) suppress
harmful fungi and produce bioactive compounds. Effect of Active Mix Bio Biological
processes occur everywhere, breaking down waste products and turning them into
useful substances. The degradation and composition can take place in different
ways depending on circumstances. By adding Active Mix Bio, the useful bacteria
receive a powerful boost at the expense of harmful micro-organisms. Active Bio Mix
supports the nitrifying effects of the biological filter as well as the degradation of
organic materials.

name: Mr Koizumi - Clean & Clear 5ltr
description_text: Mr Koizumi “Clean & Clear” contains a unique composition of bacteria designed to be used in both pond and pond filter to improve water clarity and health. Regularly adding these bacteria to the pond filter increases biological action, removing pollutants like ammonia and nitrite.  Regularly adding Clean & Clear to the pond water makes the water clearer, reduces sludge and organic materials, and keeps the water algae-free.

name: Mr Koizumi - Filter Start Gel 1tr
description_text: Mr Koizumi “Filter Start” is a mix of selected Nitrosomonas and Nitrobacter bacteria that actively break down ammonia and nitrite at a temperature from 8°C. Regularly adding these bacteria to the pond filter increases biological action, optimally removing pollutants like ammonia and nitrite and breaking down organic material, thus preventing filter clogging.  *Concentrated formular*- MR KOIZUMI “FILTER START GEL” contains around 1 BILLION colony forming units per ml making it one of the highest quality pond filter starters available!

name: Takazumi Sakan-Ni Pro 1000ml
description_text:
SAKAN-NI Pro is a mix of herbs, minerals, amino acids, fatty acids, carbohydrates, vitamins, enzymes and probiotic bacteria that will significantly strengthen the immune system of your fish to support your fish during or after injuries and periods of stress and diseases.

  • Increases resistance and strengthens the immune system
  • Detoxifies the body (removes toxic substances)
  • Purifies the blood
  • Stimulates the cleansing effect of the liver and removes toxic substances, pesticides,  medicines and heavy metals from the body
  • Ensures a strong and healthy mucous membrane 
  • Increases the production of B – lymphocytes 
  • Stimulates the production of T-lymphocytes

name: Takazumi Kein-Pro 500ml
description_text:
KIEN PRO is a complementary food for Koi.
It compensates for important nutrients that are lost in the production process of granular feed.
The improved KIEN PRO helps to aid your fish during digestion.

The unique mix of herbs, amino acids, fatty acids, vitamins, carbohydratesand minerals/trace elements and probiotics and enzymes will allow all organs involved in digestion to function in harmony.

Also, the beneficial microorganisms will eagerly use the enzymes and herbs that are in the KIEN PRO.

name: NT Labs Formaldehyde 250ml
description_text:
NT Labs Formaldehyde - Parasitic Infection Treatment

When to Use: NT Labs Formaldehyde is recommended when fish exhibit symptoms of parasitic infections, such as white spots along the fins and body, flicking and rubbing, gasping at the surface, or an opaque film over the body.

How to Use:

  1. Water Quality Check:

    • Test your pond water using NT Labs Test Kits to ensure accurate assessment.

  2. Dosage Preparation:

    • Mix the appropriate dosage in a clean bucket of pond water.

  3. Even Distribution:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly over the surface of the pond.

  4. Treatment Duration:

    • Leave the treatment in the pond for 7 days.

  5. UV Filtration:

    • Switch off UV filtration for 5 days during the treatment period.

  6. Aeration:

    • Aerate the pond well throughout the treatment.

  7. Repeat Dose Consideration:

    • If a repeat dose is deemed necessary, carefully reevaluate the diagnosis using the Diagnosis Tool. Consider alternative medications if needed.

  8. Post-Treatment:

    • After 7 days, perform a partial water change before re-treating or applying a different medication if required.

  9. Combination with Malachite:

    • If necessary, mix Formaldehyde with Malachite before adding to the pond. Follow the instructions provided above.

Warning:

  • Fish Compatibility: Do not use with orfe, rudd, tench, or sturgeon/sterlet.
  • Temperature Consideration: Do not use if the water temperature is above 30°C.
  • Weather Conditions: Do not use in hot, humid, thundery conditions.
  • Medication Mixing: Do not mix medications, except when combining with Malachite.

Always treat your pond when you have sufficient time to observe fish and respond promptly to any adverse reactions.

name: NT Labs Permanganate Dip 1 litre
description_text:
NT Labs Permanganate Dip - Treatment for Fish Lice, Leeches, Parasites, and Ulcers

When to Use: The NT Labs Permanganate Dip is suitable for treating fish lice, leeches, parasites, and ulcers in pond fish. Use it when fish exhibit visible external parasites or signs of parasitic infection such as flicking, rubbing, or gasping. It can be employed as a whole pond treatment for parasitic infections like Costia, Trichodina, Chilodonella, etc., or as a dip treatment in a separate volume of water for fish lice, leeches, and ulcer cleaning.

How to Use:

  1. Test Water Quality: Use NT Labs Test Kits to assess water quality.
  2. Whole Pond Treatment:
    • Mix the appropriate dosage in a clean bucket of pond water.
    • Pour evenly over the pond surface.
    • Switch off UV filtration until the pink color disappears.
    • Aerate the pond well during treatment.
    • After 7 days, perform a partial water change before using a different medication.
  3. Dip Treatment for Fish:
    • Add the appropriate dosage to a bucket of clean pond water.
    • Gently submerge fish.
    • Provide additional aeration during the dip.
    • Leave fish in the dip for no more than 30 minutes.
    • If a repeat dose is needed, check the diagnosis using the Diagnosis Tool.
  4. Observation and Action:
    • Treat when you can observe fish and take necessary action in case of adverse reactions.

Warnings:

  • Do not use with orfe, rudd, tench, or sturgeon/sterlet.
  • Avoid use if water temperature exceeds 22°C.
  • Do not use in hot, humid, thundery weather.
  • Do not leave fish unattended during dip treatments.
  • Limit dip treatment duration to a maximum of 30 minutes.
  • Do not mix medications.

Note: The Permanganate Dip is a versatile treatment option for various external issues in pond fish. Adhering to the provided instructions and warnings ensures effective and safe application for the well-being of the fish.

name: NT Labs Clears Green & Cloudy Water 250ml
description_text:
NT Labs Clears Green & Cloudy Water – Your Solution for Restoring Crystal Clarity to Your Pond

When to Use: NT Labs Clears Green & Cloudy Water, also known as Magiclear, is the perfect remedy when your pond water appears green and/or cloudy. This specialized treatment causes particles in the water to clump together, facilitating easy removal by settling out of suspension or through the pond filter.

How to Use:

  1. Test pH and KH:

    • Start by testing the pH and KH of the water to ensure optimal conditions for treatment.

  2. Aerate Pond Well:

    • Ensure proper pond aeration with features such as a fountain, waterfall, or air pump.

  3. Partial Water Change:

    • Conduct a partial water change, especially if the water is extremely green ("pea soup").

  4. Switch Off Pump (if necessary):

    • Temporarily switch off the pump if a strong flow rate could prevent particles from clumping. Remember to switch it back on as soon as the water clarifies.

  5. Mix Correct Dose:

    • In a clean bucket of pond water, mix the correct dose of Magiclear.

  6. Evenly Distribute Around Pond:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly around the pond.

  7. Clean Filter After Treatment:

    • Clean the collected particles from the filter after the treatment.

  8. Address Floating Clumps (if necessary):

    • Without a filter, some clumps may float, and these can be removed using a net.

  9. Observe Fish and Take Action:

    • Use Magiclear when you have sufficient time to observe the fish and take action in the unlikely event of a reaction.

Do Not:

  • Do not use when the dissolved oxygen may be low (e.g., at daybreak, in hot, humid, or thundery weather, or within three hours of feeding).
  • Do not use if the KH is below 6 or the pH is below 7.
  • Do not use if there is nitrite in the water.

Warning:

  • Failure to conduct a partial water change on extremely green water, like "pea soup," may result in a rapid reduction in oxygen, which could be dangerous to fish. Visit our knowledge hub for more information on this subject.

Trust NT Labs Clears Green & Cloudy Water (Magiclear) to restore crystal clarity to your pond and create an optimal environment for your fish. Follow the provided instructions and safety guidelines for a successful treatment experience. Count on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: NT Labs Chlorimine T 250g
description_text:
NT Labs Chloramine T – Your Solution for Treating External Bacterial and Parasitic Infections in Pond Fish

When to Use: NT Labs Chloramine T is the go-to treatment when your fish show symptoms of external bacterial infections such as ulcers, fin, tail, or mouth rot, loose scales, or parasitic infections including Costia, Trichodina, skin or gill flukes. Look out for signs like fish flicking, rubbing against rough surfaces, or gasping.

How to Use:

  1. Test Water Quality:

    • Start by testing your water quality using NT Labs Test Kits to ensure accurate diagnosis and treatment.

  2. Mix Dosage in Bucket:

    • In a clean bucket of pond water, mix the appropriate dosage of Chloramine T.

  3. Evenly Distribute Over Pond Surface:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly over the surface of the pond.

  4. Switch Off UV Filtration:

    • Turn off UV filtration until 48 hours after adding the final dose.

  5. Aerate Pond Well:

    • Ensure good pond aeration during the treatment period.

  6. Add Filter Bugs After 48 Hours:

    • Add Filter Bugs 48 hours after the final dose to boost the biological filtration in your pond.

  7. Repeat Dose or Different Medication:

    • If a repeat dose is needed, use the Diagnosis Tool to check your diagnosis. A different medication may be more suitable. Wait 10 days after the final dose, perform a partial water change before re-treating or treating with a different medication.

  8. Observe Fish and Take Action:

    • Always treat when you have time to observe fish and take appropriate action in the unlikely event of a bad reaction.

Warning:

  • Do not use with orfe, rudd, tench, or sturgeon/sterlet.
  • Wear disposable vinyl or latex gloves and appropriate eye protection when handling this product.
  • Do not use if the pH is below 7, the carbonate hardness (KH) is below 6°dH, and/or the general hardness (GH) is below 6°dH.
  • Do not use in bright sunlight or in hot, humid, thundery conditions.
  • Do not use if the water temperature is below 10°C.
  • Do not store in a hot place.
  • Do not mix medications.

Trust NT Labs Chloramine T for effective treatment of external bacterial and parasitic infections in your pond fish. Follow the provided instructions and safety guidelines for a successful treatment experience. Count on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: NT Labs Chlor-GO 1 litre
description_text:
NT Labs Chlor-Go – Your Essential Solution for Making Tap Water Safe for Fish

When to Use: NT Labs Chlor-Go is a must-have when filling or topping up your pond with tap water. Tap water contains chemicals such as chlorine, chloramine, and heavy metals that can be harmful to fish. These need to be neutralized for the water to be safe for your fish. Chlor-Go is the rapid and effective solution to turn tap water into fish-safe pond water. It should be used for all water changes and can also be employed during the transport of new or existing fish stocks.

How to Use:

  1. Dosage for Pond Volume:

    • Use the appropriate dosage for the entire volume of your pond when regularly topping up an established pond.

  2. Mix in Small Volume of Water:

    • Add the recommended dosage to a small volume of water and mix thoroughly.

  3. Split Dosage During Top-Up:

    • Add half of the mixed solution before filling the pond and the other half during the top-up process.

Usage Tips:

  • Regularly use Chlor-Go when topping up your pond to maintain fish-safe water.
  • Consider using Chlor-Go during the transport of new or existing fish stocks to ensure their well-being.

Trust NT Labs Chlor-Go for rapid and reliable neutralization of harmful chemicals in tap water, making it safe for your pond fish. Its easy-to-use formulation ensures that your water changes are stress-free for your fish. Count on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: AquaForte Bio-Stabil 2.5kg
description_text:
Improves water quality within a short time to provide a stable pond environment for Koi and other Coldwater fish whilst maintaining a consistent natural PH value, a stable alkalinity (KH) level and neutralises ammoniac and heavy metals. Fish vitality will greatly improve together with enhanced colour intensity.

  • Better water in 20 minutes: 
  • For fish vitality and enhanced colour -
  • Crystal water and natural pond environment -
  • Neutralises ammoniac and heavy metals -
  • Maintains natural KH & PH values

Dosage:

Use 100gm of BioStabil per 1000 liters of pond water and apply the required quantity direct to the pond. Continue to run filter systems during application. It is recommended to use BioStabil twice per year or when required (in the event of a KH level lower than 5 dH). BioStabil will quickly address high or low PH values.

name: Microbe Lift Natural Sludge reducer 4ltr
description_text:
MICROBE-LIFT Natural Sludge Reducer for Swimming Ponds is a 100% natural liquid derived from humus-based materials. This novel formulation is a soil science created to stimulate the natural process of  organic water purification via rapid bio-enzymatic breakdown and the removal of slow-to-degrade organic bottom solids, materials and muck. This technology has been used worldwide to enhance water quality and clarity, and to improve plant root system nutrient uptake, aiding in the control of unwanted algae and
improving overall pond bog (regeneration area/plantfilter) performance. MICROBE-LIFT Natural Sludge Reducer works in conjunction with MICROBELIFT  Natural-Clear to remove waste organic matter while enhancing pond bog effectiveness and bottom solids removal.

  • 100% Natural humus-based constituents.
  • Removes organic muck and sludge from pond water and pond bogs.
  • Reduces muck and sludge in the bog planted filter area.
  • Stimulates and speeds the biology breakdown and removal of waste organic improving water quality.
  • Improves plant root system nutrient uptake.
  • Safe for humans, pets, plants and the environment.

name: Microbe Lift GOLF 19ltr
description_text:
Specially formulated for lagoons and golf course ponds.

  • Easy to apply.
  • Environmentally friendly.
  • Breaks down organic sludge.
  • Creates a healthy pond environment.
  • Contains photosynthetic bacteria which reduces cloudy water by promoting flocculation and settling of organic and inorganic particles.
  • Reduces biological oxygen demand (BOD).
  • Improves dissolved oxygen levels.
  • Safe for all wildlife in and around your pond.
  • Safe for fish and plants.
  • Breaks down dead algae.
  • Reduces most noxious odours including hydrogen sulphide (rotten egg smell).
  • Reduces build-up of wildlife faecal matter and fish feed.

100% NATURAL, SAFE AND USEFUL BACTERIA.

name: Microbe Lift Bio Black Enzyme & Pond Colourant 500ml
description_text:
Microbe-Lift Bio-Blue is specially formulated to safely color lakes, lagoons, decorative ponds, fountains, and water features a beautiful shade of blue. Microbe-Lift Bio-Black is dark colorant, specially formulated to safely color reflecting ponds black.

  • Will not stain birds, fish, pond rocks, or most concrete fountains once diluted.
  • Safe for humans, plants, and aquatic life.
  • Colors the water with a beautiful blue or black color.
  • Blocks specific beams of light.
  • Decreases organic waste.
  • Decreases unpleasant scents.
  • No limitations for swimming, irrigation or fishing.
  • Makes unsightly water more attractive.
  • Mixes completely in hours.

Dosage: 15 ml per 1000 litres of water. For major water surfaces: 1 litre per 1000m² (1 to 2 metres deep).

Application: Shake properly before using. Dilute ML BIO-BLUE/BIO-BLACK in a bucket of
water and poor the diluted liquid into the pond, fountain, water feature, etc.

Please note: NON-DILUTED colorant could stain on concrete or rock.
The color can differ, because of the differences in water quality and chemical composition. Use half the bottle to get a certain color tone and add dosage until you reach the desired color.

name: Microbe Lift Barley Straw Pellets 1kg
description_text:
‚ 

A Major Scientific Breakthrough! 100% Natural & Organic Ingredients Specially formulated To Naturally Balance
Pond Water & Improve Water Clarity Enriched with peat and humic acid, this revolutionary formula works faster &
better with Less Mess & Cost and is easier to apply than bales, pillows and pads!
- Matures pond water chemistry.
- Disperses quickly by simple broadcast of pellets into the pond or packing in a porous fabric sock and suspending in pond or
available chamber in skimmer or filter.
- Buffers pH.
- Releases decomposition by-products immediately.
- Works year round.
- Recommended for use with all Microbe-Lift bacterial and enzymatic pond products.
Microbe-Lift/Barley Straw Pellets Pleat are rich in organic peat which softens
pond water reducing nitrate and phosphate concentrations in the water
column. The Barley Straw Pellets+ will leave a residual on the bottom of the
pond. The bacteria in the Microbe-Lift products as well as Microbe-Lift/
Sludge Away will digest this organic residual. Fish will not eat the barley
pellets as they contain no food value.

name: Green-GO Blanketweed killer 800g (2200 galls)
description_text:
GreenGo quickly kills blanketweed and inhibits new growth. It is made from high quality natural, synergetic ingredients that will not harm your fish or pond life. The elimination of
blanketweed will improve the circulation of the water through your pump and filter thereby improving the overall water quality.

Dosage:
Use a bucket or suitable container to mix 40ml of GreenGo for every 500 litres of pond water. Once the powder has fully dissolved sprinkle evenly over the pond surface (a watering can is ideal). The pond water may appear slightly milky. This is normal and will quickly clear.

For the best results, repeat the recommended dosage every four weeks during the sunny months.

name: Colombo BiOx (prevents blanket weed) 5000ml
description_text:
Colombo Biox Blanket Weed Controller works naturally by providing activated oxygen which stimulates the biological processes in the pond water resulting in a healthier environment for fish and plants.

  • 1.000 ML = 32.000 ltr
  • 2.500 ML = 80.000 ltr
  • 5.000 ML = 160.000 ltr

name: Colombo BiClear (Maintains clear water) 5ltr
description_text:
BiClear prevents the growth of floating algae and gives you crystal clear and healthy water. This product also adds and helps replenish minerals essential to healthy fish and plant life.

  • 1.000 ML = 14.000 ltr
  • 2.500 ML = 35.000 ltr
  • 5.000 ML = 70.000 ltr

name: Cloverleaf ABSOLUTE CT (Chlorimine T) 55g
description_text:
Absolute CT is used for bacteria breakouts in fresh water and
is safe for Koi and other ornamental fish. The full strength
formula is effective on bacteria infections such as Ulcers and
works by killing off bacteria and speeding up recovery time.
Dosage:
Add 10g per 1000gallons every day for a maximum of 4 days. Switch off
Ultraviolet lights until the course of treatment has been completed.

name: NT Labs Malachite 250ml
description_text:
NT Labs Malachite - Treatment for Fungal Infections

When to Use: NT Labs Malachite is recommended for use when fish exhibit symptoms of fungal infections caused by Saprolegnia. Signs of infection include white growths on the body, head, or fins, possibly with green or brown discoloration. Malachite can be used in conjunction with Formaldehyde for a more effective treatment of fungal infections.

How to Use:

  1. Test Water Quality:

    • Use NT Labs Test Kits to assess the water quality in your pond.

  2. Mixing the Dosage:

    • Mix the appropriate dosage of Malachite in a clean bucket of pond water.

  3. Application:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly over the surface of the pond.
    • Leave the treatment in the pond for 7 days.

  4. UV Filtration:

    • Switch off UV filtration until the treatment period is completed.

  5. Aeration:

    • Ensure proper aeration of the pond during the treatment.

  6. Repeat Dose:

    • If a repeat dose is deemed necessary, carefully check the diagnosis using the Diagnosis Tool. Consider using a different medication if needed.
    • Allow 7 days and perform a partial water change before re-treating or using a different medication.

  7. Observation:

    • Always treat when you have time to observe fish and take appropriate action in the unlikely event of a bad reaction.

  8. Combination with Formaldehyde:

    • If required, Malachite can be mixed with Formaldehyde before adding to the pond. Follow the instructions provided.

Warning:

  • Do not use with orfe, rudd, tench, or sturgeon/sterlet.
  • Avoid use if the water temperature is above 30°C.
  • Do not use in hot, humid, thundery conditions.
  • Do not mix medications, except when combining with Koi Care Formaldehyde.

name: NT Labs GH - Minerals Up 5kg
description_text:
NT Labs GH Minerals Up - General Hardness (GH) Booster

When to Use: NT Labs GH Minerals Up is recommended when there is a need to increase the general hardness (GH) of pond water. General hardness minerals, including calcium and magnesium, play crucial roles in various biological functions such as fish growth, metabolism, and other physiological processes. GH levels can decrease over time due to factors like rainwater influx, soft tap water, and biological processes that consume these minerals.

How to Use:

  1. Dosage Preparation:

    • Dissolve the powder in a bucket of pond water before adding it to the pond.

  2. Application:

    • Add the dissolved solution to the pond.

  3. Safety Measures:

    • Keep the product out of the reach of children.
    • Wash hands thoroughly after handling fish and the product.

  4. GH Monitoring:

    • Utilize NT Labs Hardness Test Kit to measure the GH of the pond water.

  5. Optimal GH Level:

    • Maintain the GH above 8 °dH for optimal water quality.

  6. Tap Water Adjustment:

    • GH – Minerals Up can be used to supplement general hardness in cases where tap water is naturally low in hardness minerals.

Note:

  • Regular monitoring of GH levels is advisable to ensure that the hardness remains within the desired range for the well-being of pond life.

Always follow the recommended dosage and guidelines for optimal results.

name: NT Labs Live Filter Bacteria 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Live Filter Bacteria (Mature) - Pond Health Support

When to Use: NT Labs Live Filter Bacteria, also known as Mature, is beneficial for pond health and effective biological filtration. It is recommended to use this product in the following scenarios:

  • When establishing a new filter system.
  • When adding new fish to a pond.
  • At the beginning of the season to kick start the filter after winter dormancy.
  • If ammonia or nitrite levels are above zero.
  • After cleaning the filter.
  • Weekly use to maintain a natural, unfiltered pond.

How to Use:

  1. Shake Well:

    • Shake the bottle well before use.

  2. Initial Dose:

    • Use a double dose at the start of the season or when establishing a new pond or filter.
    • Add the required dose directly into the filter if present.

  3. Weekly Maintenance:

    • Can be used weekly to control spikes in ammonia and nitrite.
    • Use NT Labs Test Kits to monitor water quality.

Warning:

  • This product cannot be overdosed.

Follow the recommended dosage and guidelines to ensure the safe and effective use of NT Labs Live Filter Bacteria (Mature) in supporting pond health and maintaining optimal water parameters.

name: NT Labs Argusol 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Argusol – Your Solution for Fish Lice, Anchor Worm, and Crustacean Parasites

When to Use: NT Labs Argusol is your go-to treatment when fish are afflicted with large external parasites such as fish lice (Argulus), anchor worm (Lernaea), and other crustacean parasites. This powerful suspension of diflubenzuron is specifically designed to combat crustacean infestations effectively.

How to Use:

  1. Test Water Quality:

    • Begin by testing your water quality using NT Labs Test Kits to ensure a suitable environment for treatment.

  2. Shake Well:

    • Shake the Argusol bottle well before use to ensure proper dispersion of the medication.

  3. Mix Correct Dosage:

    • In a clean bucket of pond water, mix the appropriate dosage of Argusol according to the provided instructions.

  4. Pour Evenly Over Pond Surface:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly over the surface of the pond for comprehensive treatment.

  5. Leave for 7 Days:

    • Allow the medication to take effect by leaving it in the pond for 7 days.

  6. Switch Off UV Filtration for 10 Days:

    • Turn off UV filtration for 10 days from the addition of the medication to enhance its efficacy.

  7. Aerate Pond Well:

    • Ensure proper aeration of the pond during the treatment period.

  8. Repeat Dose Consideration:

    • If a repeat dose is deemed necessary, carefully assess the diagnosis using the Diagnosis Tool. Consider alternative medications if needed. Wait 7 days after the initial treatment, perform a partial water change, and then re-treat or use another medication.

  9. Observation and Caution:

    • Always treat when you have time to observe the fish, and be prepared to take appropriate action in the unlikely event of a bad reaction.

Warning:

  • Do not use Argusol at water temperatures below 10°C or above 30°C.
  • Avoid application in hot, humid, or thundery weather.
  • Do not mix Argusol with other medications.

Trust NT Labs Argusol for the effective treatment of fish lice, anchor worm, and crustacean parasites. Its powerful formula, ease of use, and comprehensive instructions make it an essential tool in maintaining the health of your pond fish. Rely on NT Labs for reliable solutions in fish health management.

name: NT Labs Anti-Ulcer, Finrot & Flukes 250ml
description_text:
NT Labs Anti-Ulcer, Fin-Rot & Flukes, also known as Bacterad – Your Solution for Bacterial Infections, Fin Rot, and Flukes in Fish

When to Use: NT Labs Anti-Ulcer, Fin-Rot & Flukes, or Bacterad, is specifically formulated for use when fish display symptoms of bacterial infections. Look out for signs such as ulcers, split fins, fin rot, mouth rot, red blotches, missing scales, or clamped fins. Bacterad can also effectively treat flukes (trematodes) and is safe for sensitive species such as sturgeon, orfe, and rudd. It can be used even when Pond Salt Plus is present in the water at the 'General Tonic' level.

How to Use:

  1. Shake Well:

    • Before use, shake the Bacterad bottle well to ensure proper dispersion of the active ingredients.

  2. Mix Correct Dose:

    • In a clean bucket of pond water, mix the correct dosage of Bacterad as per the provided instructions.

  3. Evenly Distribute Around Pond:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly around the pond to ensure consistent treatment.

  4. Switch Off UV for 10 Days:

    • Turn off UV filtration for 10 days from the first Bacterad dose to allow the treatment to take full effect.

  5. Wait 10 Days After Final Dose:

    • After completing the treatment course, wait an additional 10 days before repeating the treatment or applying a different medication.

  6. Observation and Caution:

    • Allow sufficient time to observe the fish during treatment. In the unlikely event of a reaction, take appropriate action.

Usage Tips:

  • Avoid using Bacterad when the water temperature exceeds 30°C.
  • Refrain from application in hot, humid, or thundery weather.
  • Do not mix Bacterad with other medications for optimal efficacy.

Warning:

  • Do not use Bacterad in water temperatures above 30°C.
  • Avoid application in hot, humid, or thundery weather.
  • Do not mix Bacterad with other medications.

Active Ingredients: Acriflavine 80 mg/100ml Aminoacridine HCl 80 mg/100ml Formaldehyde 2260 mg/100ml

name: NT Labs Anti-Ulcer, Finrot & Flukes 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Anti-Ulcer, Fin-Rot & Flukes, also known as Bacterad – Your Solution for Bacterial Infections, Fin Rot, and Flukes in Fish

When to Use: NT Labs Anti-Ulcer, Fin-Rot & Flukes, or Bacterad, is specifically formulated for use when fish display symptoms of bacterial infections. Look out for signs such as ulcers, split fins, fin rot, mouth rot, red blotches, missing scales, or clamped fins. Bacterad can also effectively treat flukes (trematodes) and is safe for sensitive species such as sturgeon, orfe, and rudd. It can be used even when Pond Salt Plus is present in the water at the 'General Tonic' level.

How to Use:

  1. Shake Well:

    • Before use, shake the Bacterad bottle well to ensure proper dispersion of the active ingredients.

  2. Mix Correct Dose:

    • In a clean bucket of pond water, mix the correct dosage of Bacterad as per the provided instructions.

  3. Evenly Distribute Around Pond:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly around the pond to ensure consistent treatment.

  4. Switch Off UV for 10 Days:

    • Turn off UV filtration for 10 days from the first Bacterad dose to allow the treatment to take full effect.

  5. Wait 10 Days After Final Dose:

    • After completing the treatment course, wait an additional 10 days before repeating the treatment or applying a different medication.

  6. Observation and Caution:

    • Allow sufficient time to observe the fish during treatment. In the unlikely event of a reaction, take appropriate action.

Usage Tips:

  • Avoid using Bacterad when the water temperature exceeds 30°C.
  • Refrain from application in hot, humid, or thundery weather.
  • Do not mix Bacterad with other medications for optimal efficacy.

Warning:

  • Do not use Bacterad in water temperatures above 30°C.

name: Colombo Wound Cleaner 50ml
description_text:
Colombo Wound Cleaner 50ml is a powerful anti-septic for wounds on fish. This effective wound care solution is composed of a diluted hydrogen peroxide solution to safely disinfect wounds and help remove dead tissue, allowing for a quick and complete recovery.

Combine with Colombo Sedation and Colombo Propolis Wound Spray for the best results.

name: Colombo Sedation 20ml
description_text: Colombo Sedation Liquid is a 100% natural product intended for mild sedation of ornamental fish. It offers an easy, efficient, and safe method to help fish remain calm during transport or treatment and has no negative side effects. The liquid can be dosed at 20 drops per 10 litres of pond water, ensuring a safe and secure sedation process.

name: Pond Medic Acriflavin 1ltr
description_text:
Pond Medic Acriflavin is used to treat bacterial and fungal infections in fish. It can be effective against a range of common fish diseases, including fin rot, mouth rot, and external bacterial and fungal infections.

Acriflavin works by interfering with the metabolism and growth of bacteria and fungi. It disrupts their cellular processes, inhibiting their ability to reproduce and causing their eventual death.

The treatment involves adding the recommended dosage of the medication directly to the water in the pond or aquarium.

While Acriflavin is generally considered safe for fish when used as directed, it is essential to follow the recommended dosage and treatment guidelines. Overdosing can be harmful to fish, particularly sensitive species. Additionally, Acriflavin may stain the water yellow, but this is temporary and will usually dissipate over time.

name: The water cleanser 200g
description_text:
What is the Water Cleanser?

The Water Cleanser (TWC) is best described as a microbiological culture pad.
If you look at TWC under a powerful microscope, it is full of millions of microscopic
capillaries that progress from one end through to the other. These microscopic
capillaries provide the ultimate home for all the required beneficial bacteria and
microbes that maintain the health of water. TWC also provides the required trace
elements for the microbes to thrive and function to their optimal levels whilst also
providing the breeding trace elements for Archaea microbes and Bacillus bacteria

How does it work?
Beneficial bacteria and microbes naturally break down and process organic waste (excess food, plant matter, dying algae, fish faeces, etc.) in water systems. Outside influences such as chemicals, pollutants, and fertilizers can disrupt the natural cycle and weaken the existing beneficial bacteria. The Water Cleanser (TWC) provides a protective habitat with all the required trace elements that allow the microbes to breed and multiply at their optimal rate. Once the microbes are re-established in the water system, they can then consume the organic waste at an accelerated rate, leaving the water cleaner and healthier, and requiring less maintenance.

Archaea microbes prefer to break down organic waste above oil but need hydrocarbon as an energy source to multiply. Archaea microbes are present in any body of water but remain inactive until they have a hydrocarbon source. The Water Cleanser is a hydrocarbon catalyst that creates the perfect conditions for these Archaea microbes.

Does TWC prevent algae?
Yes! Excess nutrients in the water from organic waste can encourage overgrowth of algae, including algal blooms. The Water Cleanser accelerates proliferation of beneficial bacteria and microbes which consume that organic matter. Massive algal blooms require lots of nutrients; with their food source consumed by the microbes, the algae starves and dies.

The Water Cleanser has been tested for over 12 years and has a beneficial effect on all aquatic life. Besides that, the Water Cleanser can also be used in pools to lower the need for chemicals.

Usage.

  • 1 Block (200g) treats 265 gal. (for Aquarium tanks) 
  • 1 Block (200g) treats 800 gal. (for Koi / fish ponds)
  • For cloudy or overcrowded water double the dosage. 

    •  

    Replace every 3 months, leaving the old product in place for a one week overlap.

name: Mr Koizumi - Bio Clear Flocculant 5ltr
description_text: Mr Koizumi “BioClear” contains a composition of 6 concentrated bacteria aimed at the direct breakdown of organic material. These bacteria break down sludge and act on suspended dirt particles, making pond water clearer in a natural way. Additionally, Bioclear bacteria consume the same nutrients that algae need to grow, reducing the risk of algae blooms and green water.  Bioclear can also be added to the pond filter to prevent blockages, improve water flow rate, and reduce maintenance frequency.

name: NT Labs Malachite 2.5 litre
description_text:
NT Labs Malachite - Treatment for Fungal Infections

When to Use: NT Labs Malachite is recommended for use when fish exhibit symptoms of fungal infections caused by Saprolegnia. Signs of infection include white growths on the body, head, or fins, possibly with green or brown discoloration. Malachite can be used in conjunction with Formaldehyde for a more effective treatment of fungal infections.

How to Use:

  1. Test Water Quality:

    • Use NT Labs Test Kits to assess the water quality in your pond.

  2. Mixing the Dosage:

    • Mix the appropriate dosage of Malachite in a clean bucket of pond water.

  3. Application:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly over the surface of the pond.
    • Leave the treatment in the pond for 7 days.

  4. UV Filtration:

    • Switch off UV filtration until the treatment period is completed.

  5. Aeration:

    • Ensure proper aeration of the pond during the treatment.

  6. Repeat Dose:

    • If a repeat dose is deemed necessary, carefully check the diagnosis using the Diagnosis Tool. Consider using a different medication if needed.
    • Allow 7 days and perform a partial water change before re-treating or using a different medication.

  7. Observation:

    • Always treat when you have time to observe fish and take appropriate action in the unlikely event of a bad reaction.

  8. Combination with Formaldehyde:

    • If required, Malachite can be mixed with Formaldehyde before adding to the pond. Follow the instructions provided.

Warning:

  • Do not use with orfe, rudd, tench, or sturgeon/sterlet.
  • Avoid use if the water temperature is above 30°C.
  • Do not use in hot, humid, thundery conditions.
  • Do not mix medications, except when combining with Koi Care Formaldehyde.

name: NT Labs Permanganate Dip 2.5 litre
description_text:
NT Labs Permanganate Dip - Treatment for Fish Lice, Leeches, Parasites, and Ulcers

When to Use: The NT Labs Permanganate Dip is suitable for treating fish lice, leeches, parasites, and ulcers in pond fish. Use it when fish exhibit visible external parasites or signs of parasitic infection such as flicking, rubbing, or gasping. It can be employed as a whole pond treatment for parasitic infections like Costia, Trichodina, Chilodonella, etc., or as a dip treatment in a separate volume of water for fish lice, leeches, and ulcer cleaning.

How to Use:

  1. Test Water Quality: Use NT Labs Test Kits to assess water quality.
  2. Whole Pond Treatment:
    • Mix the appropriate dosage in a clean bucket of pond water.
    • Pour evenly over the pond surface.
    • Switch off UV filtration until the pink color disappears.
    • Aerate the pond well during treatment.
    • After 7 days, perform a partial water change before using a different medication.
  3. Dip Treatment for Fish:
    • Add the appropriate dosage to a bucket of clean pond water.
    • Gently submerge fish.
    • Provide additional aeration during the dip.
    • Leave fish in the dip for no more than 30 minutes.
    • If a repeat dose is needed, check the diagnosis using the Diagnosis Tool.
  4. Observation and Action:
    • Treat when you can observe fish and take necessary action in case of adverse reactions.

Warnings:

  • Do not use with orfe, rudd, tench, or sturgeon/sterlet.
  • Avoid use if water temperature exceeds 22°C.
  • Do not use in hot, humid, thundery weather.
  • Do not leave fish unattended during dip treatments.
  • Limit dip treatment duration to a maximum of 30 minutes.
  • Do not mix medications.

Note: The Permanganate Dip is a versatile treatment option for various external issues in pond fish. Adhering to the provided instructions and warnings ensures effective and safe application for the well-being of the fish.

name: NT Labs Tap Water Chlorine Remover 1ltr
description_text:
NT Labs Tap Water Chlorine Remover (Aquasure)

When to use? Use Aquasure, also known as Tap Water Chlorine Remover, when topping up your pond or when initially filling it with tap water. Domestic tap water can contain harmful substances, with chlorine and chloramine being among the most dangerous to pond life. Aquasure is designed to safely neutralize chlorine, chloramine, other halogens, and heavy metals that can be toxic to fish. Additionally, it can help reduce shock during transportation.

How to use:

  1. Shake the bottle well before use.
  2. Mix the correct dose in a clean bucket of pond water.
  3. Pour the mixture evenly around the pond before topping up or filling it with tap water.

Usage Tips:

  • If refilling with a hosepipe, use enough Aquasure to treat the entire volume of the pond.
  • You can also use Aquasure on smaller volumes of water before adding them to your pond.

Warning:

  • For use in ornamental ponds only.
  • This product cannot be overdosed.

Aquasure ensures that tap water added to your pond is safe for fish and helps maintain a healthy and stress-free environment.

name: NT Labs Filter Bugs 250ml
description_text:
NT Labs Filter Bugs – Your Solution for Efficient Biological Filtration in Ponds

When to Use: NT Labs Filter Bugs is your go-to solution when establishing a new filter, at the beginning of the pond season in spring, or whenever ammonia or nitrite levels are elevated. This easy-to-use liquid formulation contains a blend of Nitrosomonas, Nitrobacter, Nitrospira, and supporting bacterial cultures. These bacteria play a crucial role in repopulating your filter with nitrifying organisms, ensuring efficient biological filtration and maintaining stable water quality.

How to Use:

  1. Test Your Water:

    • Use NT Labs Test Kits to accurately measure your water parameters.

  2. Measure Filter Bugs:

    • Measure out the required amount of Filter Bugs based on your pond's size.

  3. Add to Biological Media:

    • Directly add the measured Filter Bugs amount to the biological media within the filter.

  4. Switch Off UV Filtration:

    • Switch off UV filtration for at least 24 hours after adding Filter Bugs. This allows the nitrifying bacteria to colonize the filter and the pond.

  5. Recommended Usage:

    • Add Filter Bugs immediately after a substantial water change, pond clean, at the start of the pond season, after using medicinal treatments, or adding new fish. Also, use whenever there's a detectable concentration of ammonia or nitrite in the water. Filter Bugs can be added once per week or more often if desired.

  6. Compatibility with Pond Salt Plus:

    • Filter Bugs can be used when Pond Salt Plus is present in the water at 'General Tonic' and 'Anti-stress' levels.

Warning:

  • Ammonia and nitrite are toxic to fish. Ensure concentrations are 0 ppm at all times using NT Labs Test Kits. If dangerous concentrations are present, conduct a partial water change before using Filter Bugs. Identify and resolve the cause of poor water quality to prevent stress to your fish.

Trust NT Labs Filter Bugs for a healthy pond environment and efficient biological filtration. Keep your water quality in check with this reliable solution.

name: NT Labs Clears Green & Cloudy Water 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Clears Green & Cloudy Water – Your Solution for Restoring Crystal Clarity to Your Pond

When to Use: NT Labs Clears Green & Cloudy Water, also known as Magiclear, is the perfect remedy when your pond water appears green and/or cloudy. This specialized treatment causes particles in the water to clump together, facilitating easy removal by settling out of suspension or through the pond filter.

How to Use:

  1. Test pH and KH:

    • Start by testing the pH and KH of the water to ensure optimal conditions for treatment.

  2. Aerate Pond Well:

    • Ensure proper pond aeration with features such as a fountain, waterfall, or air pump.

  3. Partial Water Change:

    • Conduct a partial water change, especially if the water is extremely green ("pea soup").

  4. Switch Off Pump (if necessary):

    • Temporarily switch off the pump if a strong flow rate could prevent particles from clumping. Remember to switch it back on as soon as the water clarifies.

  5. Mix Correct Dose:

    • In a clean bucket of pond water, mix the correct dose of Magiclear.

  6. Evenly Distribute Around Pond:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly around the pond.

  7. Clean Filter After Treatment:

    • Clean the collected particles from the filter after the treatment.

  8. Address Floating Clumps (if necessary):

    • Without a filter, some clumps may float, and these can be removed using a net.

  9. Observe Fish and Take Action:

    • Use Magiclear when you have sufficient time to observe the fish and take action in the unlikely event of a reaction.

Do Not:

  • Do not use when the dissolved oxygen may be low (e.g., at daybreak, in hot, humid, or thundery weather, or within three hours of feeding).
  • Do not use if the KH is below 6 or the pH is below 7.
  • Do not use if there is nitrite in the water.

Warning:

  • Failure to conduct a partial water change on extremely green water, like "pea soup," may result in a rapid reduction in oxygen, which could be dangerous to fish. Visit our knowledge hub for more information on this subject.

Trust NT Labs Clears Green & Cloudy Water (Magiclear) to restore crystal clarity to your pond and create an optimal environment for your fish. Follow the provided instructions and safety guidelines for a successful treatment experience. Count on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: NT Labs Blanketweed balance 2kg
description_text:
NT Labs Blanket Balance – Your Solution for Controlling Blanketweed Growth and Re-Balancing Water Quality

When to Use: NT Labs Blanket Balance is designed to be administered when your pond starts to show signs of blanketweed growth. This specialized treatment utilizes natural ingredients to re-mineralize and re-balance the water quality, addressing the conditions that contribute to blanketweed development. Blanket Balance is completely safe for fish, plants, and biological filtration systems.

How to Use:

  1. Ensure Pond Aeration and Water Quality:

    • Before administering the dose, ensure your pond is well-aerated, and test the water quality using NT Labs Test Kits for accurate measurements.

  2. Mix Correct Dose:

    • In a clean bucket or watering can filled with pond water, mix the required dose of Blanket Balance according to the provided instructions.

  3. Pour Evenly Around Pond:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly around the pond and on watercourses or falls for comprehensive coverage.

  4. Cloud Formation is Normal:

    • After application, a cloud may form in the water column. This is a normal and safe reaction that will clear after a few hours.

  5. Post-Treatment Recommendation:

    • One week after dosing Blanketweed Balance, it is recommended to use Sludge Remover (Sludgeclear) to aid in the digestion of organic material in the pond.

Warning:

  • Do not use Blanketweed Balance when dissolved oxygen may be low (e.g., at daybreak, in hot, humid, or thundery weather, or within three hours of feeding).
  • Avoid use if your water quality is poor or fish are showing symptoms of ill health.
  • UV filters can be left on during application.
  • Wash your hands after use.

Trust NT Labs Blanket Balance to effectively control blanketweed growth and re-balance water quality in your pond. Its natural ingredients and safe formulation make it an excellent choice for maintaining a healthy pond environment. Count on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: Malamix17 5L (50.000L)
description_text:
Why is Malamix17 good for your pond? Every pond contains a certain amount of pathogens: weaker fish are more susceptible to these dangers. The health of your fish starts with a healthy and strong mucus layer. Therefore, it is important to add Malamix17 to your pond on a regular basis. This ideal mix of vitamins, herbal and plant extracts will increase the immune system of your fish in a significant way. The active ingredients of Malamix17 are absorbed through both the skin and the gills of the fish. They enhance the health of the skin and form the basis for a healthy mucus layer, which in turn provides an optimal natural defense against diseases.

Malamix17 also contains nutrients/enzymes which enhance the filter bacteria and probiotics in your pond. This improves the water quality and protects your fish against ‘hole disease’.

How and when to use Malamix17: To obtain an optimal mucus layer (and thus immunity),
it is advisable to administer Malamix17 every two to three months, from the moment the water temperature reaches 5°c. Malamix17 consists of purely biological components, which means that overdosing is not possible. Malamix17 is the ideal solution to restore water quality and cure the health of the mucus layer of your fish after a chemical treatment.

name: Colombo Medic Box - Wound and Ulcer treatment kit
description_text: The medic box contains all products for treating wounds in a handy set. The medic box includes: an anaesthetic, a propolis wound spray and a wound cleaner.

name: Evolution Aqua Pure Bomb Counter display (inc 36pcs)
description_text:
Evolution Aqua PURE Pond Bomb is a fast acting, concentrated version of the Award Winning Evolution Aqua PURE POND. Evolution Aqua PURE Pond Bomb is ideal for use in Koi ponds, ornamental ponds, self contained water features or ponds which do not have conventional filtration, to achieve crystal clear, healthy water.

Inside the Evolution Aqua PURE Pond Bomb there is a unique combination of friendly bacteria and enzymes, which get to work as soon as the Bomb hits the water to clean up organic waste and break down the ammonia and nitrite, leaving your pond crystal clear and healthy.

One PURE Pond Bomb is effective on ponds up to 20,000 litres.

Directions of use:

Simply drop the Evolution Aqua PURE Pond Bomb into your pond filter or directly into the water as and when necessary. The bacteria and enzymes will react to clarity issues in your pond. You cannot overdose with the Evolution Aqua PURE Pond Bomb. When starting up a new filter, simply drop the Evolution Aqua PURE Pond Bomb into the biological stage of your filter. The high concentration of bacteria will help to remove the harmful ammonia and nitrite, allowing the filter media to mature.

name: Microbe Lift GOLF 4ltr
description_text:
Specially formulated for lagoons and golf course ponds.

  • Easy to apply.
  • Environmentally friendly.
  • Breaks down organic sludge.
  • Creates a healthy pond environment.
  • Contains photosynthetic bacteria which reduces cloudy water by promoting flocculation and settling of organic and inorganic particles.
  • Reduces biological oxygen demand (BOD).
  • Improves dissolved oxygen levels.
  • Safe for all wildlife in and around your pond.
  • Safe for fish and plants.
  • Breaks down dead algae.
  • Reduces most noxious odours including hydrogen sulphide (rotten egg smell).
  • Reduces build-up of wildlife faecal matter and fish feed.

100% NATURAL, SAFE AND USEFUL BACTERIA.

name: Colombo BiClear (Maintains clear water) 2.5ltr
description_text:
BiClear prevents the growth of floating algae and gives you crystal clear and healthy water. This product also adds and helps replenish minerals essential to healthy fish and plant life.

  • 1.000 ML = 14.000 ltr
  • 2.500 ML = 35.000 ltr
  • 5.000 ML = 70.000 ltr

name: ActiveX - 300ml
description_text:
Activex is for the colonisation of filtration bacteria and differs from similar filter products
as it contains a gel, which creates a retention substrate in the filter for the bacteria to multiply on
more quickly and effectively. The gel substrate is harmless and feeds the bacteria. Introduce 10 ml
of Activex per cubic foot of biological filter.

name: ActiveX - 500ml
description_text:
Activex is for the colonisation of filtration bacteria and differs from similar filter products
as it contains a gel, which creates a retention substrate in the filter for the bacteria to multiply on
more quickly and effectively. The gel substrate is harmless and feeds the bacteria. Introduce 10 ml
of Activex per cubic foot of biological filter.

name: NT Labs Satus 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Satus quickly establishes & enhances aquarium biofilters. It accelerates the maturing of aquarium systems, and prevents ‘new tank syndrome’, therefore making new aquariums safe for fish.

Satus is a valuable new tool for all fish keepers as it quickly establishes and accelerates the maturing of aquarium systems.

Satus contains our innovative ‘Satus organism’ capable of rapidly removing ammonia without relying on the traditional, slower nitrifying cycle. Working under both aerobic and anaerobic conditions, our ‘Satus organism’ can also degrade organic compounds which bacteria cannot. It has a higher metabolic rate that provides faster breakdown of organic wastes to prevent them building up in the aquarium.  

Satus also contains a concentrated unique blend of heterotrophic and autotrophic organisms, including aerobic and anaerobic nitrifying bacteria that rapidly remove harmful ammonia and nitrite by converting them into nitrates, and will not produce hydrogen sulphide. This process prevents toxic ‘new tank syndrome’ providing a safer environment for your fish. Satus is harmless to all aquatic species including plants and cannot be overdosed. 

How to use:

  • Shake bottle thoroughly before use.
  • Turn off UV/ozone. Turn back on 2 hours after adding Satus.
  • Calculate aquarium volume litres (length x width x depth (in cm)/1000). 
  • See label for full dose rate 
  • If dosage is maintained for the full 7 days, fish and other aquatic species can be added to the aquarium at any point. 
  • Add monthly for improved biofilter function and add; when introducing new fish, after each filter clean/water change, after treating the aquarium with medication. 
  • Keep out of reach of children. Store in a cool dry place. 
  • Satus cannot be used as a replacement for an aquarium filter but should be used alongside one.

name: Takazumi Kein-Pro 1000ml
description_text:
KIEN PRO is a complementary food for Koi.
It compensates for important nutrients that are lost in the production process of granular feed.
The improved KIEN PRO helps to aid your fish during digestion.

The unique mix of herbs, amino acids, fatty acids, vitamins, carbohydratesand minerals/trace elements and probiotics and enzymes will allow all organs involved in digestion to function in harmony.

Also, the beneficial microorganisms will eagerly use the enzymes and herbs that are in the KIEN PRO.

name: NT Labs Formaldehyde 1 litre
description_text:
NT Labs Formaldehyde - Parasitic Infection Treatment

When to Use: NT Labs Formaldehyde is recommended when fish exhibit symptoms of parasitic infections, such as white spots along the fins and body, flicking and rubbing, gasping at the surface, or an opaque film over the body.

How to Use:

  1. Water Quality Check:

    • Test your pond water using NT Labs Test Kits to ensure accurate assessment.

  2. Dosage Preparation:

    • Mix the appropriate dosage in a clean bucket of pond water.

  3. Even Distribution:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly over the surface of the pond.

  4. Treatment Duration:

    • Leave the treatment in the pond for 7 days.

  5. UV Filtration:

    • Switch off UV filtration for 5 days during the treatment period.

  6. Aeration:

    • Aerate the pond well throughout the treatment.

  7. Repeat Dose Consideration:

    • If a repeat dose is deemed necessary, carefully reevaluate the diagnosis using the Diagnosis Tool. Consider alternative medications if needed.

  8. Post-Treatment:

    • After 7 days, perform a partial water change before re-treating or applying a different medication if required.

  9. Combination with Malachite:

    • If necessary, mix Formaldehyde with Malachite before adding to the pond. Follow the instructions provided above.

Warning:

  • Fish Compatibility: Do not use with orfe, rudd, tench, or sturgeon/sterlet.
  • Temperature Consideration: Do not use if the water temperature is above 30°C.
  • Weather Conditions: Do not use in hot, humid, thundery conditions.
  • Medication Mixing: Do not mix medications, except when combining with Malachite.

Always treat your pond when you have sufficient time to observe fish and respond promptly to any adverse reactions.

name: NT Labs Malachite 1 litre
description_text:
NT Labs Malachite - Treatment for Fungal Infections

When to Use: NT Labs Malachite is recommended for use when fish exhibit symptoms of fungal infections caused by Saprolegnia. Signs of infection include white growths on the body, head, or fins, possibly with green or brown discoloration. Malachite can be used in conjunction with Formaldehyde for a more effective treatment of fungal infections.

How to Use:

  1. Test Water Quality:

    • Use NT Labs Test Kits to assess the water quality in your pond.

  2. Mixing the Dosage:

    • Mix the appropriate dosage of Malachite in a clean bucket of pond water.

  3. Application:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly over the surface of the pond.
    • Leave the treatment in the pond for 7 days.

  4. UV Filtration:

    • Switch off UV filtration until the treatment period is completed.

  5. Aeration:

    • Ensure proper aeration of the pond during the treatment.

  6. Repeat Dose:

    • If a repeat dose is deemed necessary, carefully check the diagnosis using the Diagnosis Tool. Consider using a different medication if needed.
    • Allow 7 days and perform a partial water change before re-treating or using a different medication.

  7. Observation:

    • Always treat when you have time to observe fish and take appropriate action in the unlikely event of a bad reaction.

  8. Combination with Formaldehyde:

    • If required, Malachite can be mixed with Formaldehyde before adding to the pond. Follow the instructions provided.

Warning:

  • Do not use with orfe, rudd, tench, or sturgeon/sterlet.
  • Avoid use if the water temperature is above 30°C.
  • Do not use in hot, humid, thundery conditions.
  • Do not mix medications, except when combining with Koi Care Formaldehyde.

name: NT Labs KH - Buffer Up 20kg
description_text:
NT Labs KH Buffer Up - Carbonate Hardness (KH) Booster

When to Use: NT Labs KH Buffer Up is recommended when there is a need to increase the carbonate hardness (KH) of pond water. Pond fish require a safe and stable pH to maintain optimal health. Over time, as pond water ages and fish waste along with other organic matter accumulates, it can deplete the carbonate hardness (KH) responsible for providing a safe and stable pH. Insufficient KH levels can lead to unstable water quality, a sudden drop in pH, and potential illness in fish.

How to Use:

  1. Dosage Preparation:

    • Dissolve the powder in a bucket of pond water before adding it to the pond.

  2. Application:

    • Add the dissolved solution to the pond.

  3. Safety Measures:

    • Keep the product out of the reach of children.
    • Wash hands thoroughly after handling fish and the product.

  4. KH Monitoring:

    • Use NT Labs Hardness Test Kit to measure the KH of the pond water.

  5. Optimal KH Level:

    • Maintain the KH above 6 °dH for optimal water quality.

  6. Tap Water Adjustment:

    • KH – Buffer Up can be used to supplement carbonate hardness in cases where tap water is naturally low in hardness minerals.

Note:

  • Regular monitoring of KH levels is advisable to ensure that the carbonate hardness remains within the desired range for the well-being of pond life.

Always follow the recommended dosage and guidelines for optimal results.

name: NT Labs Mediclay 5kg
description_text:
NT Labs Mediclay - Water Re-Mineralization and Clarity

When to Use: NT Labs Mediclay is recommended for use as a weekly additive to re-mineralize pond water. It helps control the buildup of organic waste, bacteria, and pollutants that can lead to bacterial infections and compromised fish health. Additionally, Mediclay stimulates the biological system in favor of beneficial bacteria, aiding in the reduction of algae. It contributes to water clarity, providing a better environment for observing fish.

How to Use:

  1. Mixing the Dose:

    • Mix the required dose of Mediclay in a clean bucket or watering can with pond water.

  2. Application:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly over the surface of the pond or at a filter outlet to ensure even distribution.

  3. Water Clarification:

    • For water clarification, it's best to apply Mediclay via the pump or venturi so that it is rapidly mixed with the returning water.

  4. Conjunction with Other Treatments:

    • Use in conjunction with other NT Labs water treatments, but allow a 48-hour gap after applying an NT Labs Medication before using Mediclay.

  5. Year-Round Use:

    • Mediclay can be used at any time of the year regardless of water temperature.
    • It does not alter the water pH.

Do Not:

  • Use within 48 hours of applying another medication.

Note:

  • Regular use of Mediclay contributes to maintaining water quality and clarity in the pond.
