name: NT Labs Live Filter Bacteria 1ltr
description_text:
NT Labs Live Filter Bacteria (Mature) - Pond Health Support

When to Use: NT Labs Live Filter Bacteria, also known as Mature, is beneficial for pond health and effective biological filtration. It is recommended to use this product in the following scenarios:

  • When establishing a new filter system.
  • When adding new fish to a pond.
  • At the beginning of the season to kick start the filter after winter dormancy.
  • If ammonia or nitrite levels are above zero.
  • After cleaning the filter.
  • Weekly use to maintain a natural, unfiltered pond.

How to Use:

  1. Shake Well:

    • Shake the bottle well before use.

  2. Initial Dose:

    • Use a double dose at the start of the season or when establishing a new pond or filter.
    • Add the required dose directly into the filter if present.

  3. Weekly Maintenance:

    • Can be used weekly to control spikes in ammonia and nitrite.
    • Use NT Labs Test Kits to monitor water quality.

Warning:

  • This product cannot be overdosed.

Follow the recommended dosage and guidelines to ensure the safe and effective use of NT Labs Live Filter Bacteria (Mature) in supporting pond health and maintaining optimal water parameters.

name: Microbe Lift Barley Straw Pellets 2kg
description_text:
‚ 

A Major Scientific Breakthrough! 100% Natural & Organic Ingredients Specially formulated To Naturally Balance
Pond Water & Improve Water Clarity Enriched with peat and humic acid, this revolutionary formula works faster &
better with Less Mess & Cost and is easier to apply than bales, pillows and pads!
- Matures pond water chemistry.
- Disperses quickly by simple broadcast of pellets into the pond or packing in a porous fabric sock and suspending in pond or
available chamber in skimmer or filter.
- Buffers pH.
- Releases decomposition by-products immediately.
- Works year round.
- Recommended for use with all Microbe-Lift bacterial and enzymatic pond products.
Microbe-Lift/Barley Straw Pellets Pleat are rich in organic peat which softens
pond water reducing nitrate and phosphate concentrations in the water
column. The Barley Straw Pellets+ will leave a residual on the bottom of the
pond. The bacteria in the Microbe-Lift products as well as Microbe-Lift/
Sludge Away will digest this organic residual. Fish will not eat the barley
pellets as they contain no food value.

name: Bacto-Plus Gel 2.5ltr
description_text:
Bactoplus Professional Pond Bacteria
Fish produce ammonia around the clock, this is released when
absorbing oxygen through the gills. Ammonia is formed in a toxic form
when the pH is above 7,4. In a biological filter bacteria convert
ammonia via nitrite into nitrate. For this conversion two kinds of
bacteria are needed. The first group converts ammonia into nitrites,
these bacteria are also called ‚‚¹AOB‚‚¾‚. The second group converts
nitrite into nitrate, these bacteria are also called ‚‚¹NOB‚‚¾‚.
Both processes take place with the use of oxygen; hence it is
important that the water flowing through the filter is rich in oxygen.
BactoPlus Filter Starter (gel) contains both AOB and NOB and in high
quantities. During production 800 million bacteria per ml. are added
to the products. Use these products when starting a new filter, after
maintenance andwhen having problems with the water quality. When
the filter is easy to access and the filter media can be set dry,
the Gel version of the product can be applied directly to the filter
media, which is enhancing the effect.

name: NT Labs GH - Minerals Up 20kg
description_text:
NT Labs GH Minerals Up - General Hardness (GH) Booster

When to Use: NT Labs GH Minerals Up is recommended when there is a need to increase the general hardness (GH) of pond water. General hardness minerals, including calcium and magnesium, play crucial roles in various biological functions such as fish growth, metabolism, and other physiological processes. GH levels can decrease over time due to factors like rainwater influx, soft tap water, and biological processes that consume these minerals.

How to Use:

  1. Dosage Preparation:

    • Dissolve the powder in a bucket of pond water before adding it to the pond.

  2. Application:

    • Add the dissolved solution to the pond.

  3. Safety Measures:

    • Keep the product out of the reach of children.
    • Wash hands thoroughly after handling fish and the product.

  4. GH Monitoring:

    • Utilize NT Labs Hardness Test Kit to measure the GH of the pond water.

  5. Optimal GH Level:

    • Maintain the GH above 8 °dH for optimal water quality.

  6. Tap Water Adjustment:

    • GH – Minerals Up can be used to supplement general hardness in cases where tap water is naturally low in hardness minerals.

Note:

  • Regular monitoring of GH levels is advisable to ensure that the hardness remains within the desired range for the well-being of pond life.

Always follow the recommended dosage and guidelines for optimal results.

name: NT Labs Tap Water Chlorine Remover 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Tap Water Chlorine Remover (Aquasure)

When to use? Use Aquasure, also known as Tap Water Chlorine Remover, when topping up your pond or when initially filling it with tap water. Domestic tap water can contain harmful substances, with chlorine and chloramine being among the most dangerous to pond life. Aquasure is designed to safely neutralize chlorine, chloramine, other halogens, and heavy metals that can be toxic to fish. Additionally, it can help reduce shock during transportation.

How to use:

  1. Shake the bottle well before use.
  2. Mix the correct dose in a clean bucket of pond water.
  3. Pour the mixture evenly around the pond before topping up or filling it with tap water.

Usage Tips:

  • If refilling with a hosepipe, use enough Aquasure to treat the entire volume of the pond.
  • You can also use Aquasure on smaller volumes of water before adding them to your pond.

Warning:

  • For use in ornamental ponds only.
  • This product cannot be overdosed.

Aquasure ensures that tap water added to your pond is safe for fish and helps maintain a healthy and stress-free environment.

name: NT Labs Blanketweed balance 800g
description_text:
NT Labs Blanket Balance – Your Solution for Controlling Blanketweed Growth and Re-Balancing Water Quality

When to Use: NT Labs Blanket Balance is designed to be administered when your pond starts to show signs of blanketweed growth. This specialized treatment utilizes natural ingredients to re-mineralize and re-balance the water quality, addressing the conditions that contribute to blanketweed development. Blanket Balance is completely safe for fish, plants, and biological filtration systems.

How to Use:

  1. Ensure Pond Aeration and Water Quality:

    • Before administering the dose, ensure your pond is well-aerated, and test the water quality using NT Labs Test Kits for accurate measurements.

  2. Mix Correct Dose:

    • In a clean bucket or watering can filled with pond water, mix the required dose of Blanket Balance according to the provided instructions.

  3. Pour Evenly Around Pond:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly around the pond and on watercourses or falls for comprehensive coverage.

  4. Cloud Formation is Normal:

    • After application, a cloud may form in the water column. This is a normal and safe reaction that will clear after a few hours.

  5. Post-Treatment Recommendation:

    • One week after dosing Blanketweed Balance, it is recommended to use Sludge Remover (Sludgeclear) to aid in the digestion of organic material in the pond.

Warning:

  • Do not use Blanketweed Balance when dissolved oxygen may be low (e.g., at daybreak, in hot, humid, or thundery weather, or within three hours of feeding).
  • Avoid use if your water quality is poor or fish are showing symptoms of ill health.
  • UV filters can be left on during application.
  • Wash your hands after use.

Trust NT Labs Blanket Balance to effectively control blanketweed growth and re-balance water quality in your pond. Its natural ingredients and safe formulation make it an excellent choice for maintaining a healthy pond environment. Count on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: NT Labs Blanketweed & Algae Control 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Blanketweed & Algae Control, also known as Aquaclear – Your Solution for Preventing Unsightly Algae and Blanket Weed

When to Use: NT Labs Blanketweed & Algae Control, or Aquaclear, is the ideal solution for preventing the growth of unsightly green algae and blanket weed in your pond. This treatment utilizes a long-lasting blue dye that restricts sunlight penetration through the water column, effectively cutting off the light source that promotes algae and blanket weed growth. Use Aquaclear as a preventive measure, especially in the spring before algae becomes too established. It is harmless to all other forms of life in the pond.

How to Use:

  1. Shake Well:

    • Before use, shake the Aquaclear bottle well to ensure an even distribution of the blue dye.

  2. Use in Spring or After Magiclear:

    • For optimal results, use Aquaclear in the spring before algae becomes too established. Alternatively, use Magiclear first to clarify the water and then follow up with Aquaclear for complete control.

  3. Monthly Repeated Additions:

    • For ongoing control, make repeated monthly additions of Aquaclear as the color fades. The water will take on a subtle blue hue, leaving pond plants unharmed.

  4. Mix Correct Dose:

    • In a clean bucket of pond water, mix the correct dosage of Aquaclear according to the provided instructions.

  5. Pour Evenly Around Pond:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly around the pond to ensure uniform treatment.

Warning:

  • Avoid staining clothing during the application of Aquaclear.
  • For use in ornamental ponds only.

Trust NT Labs Blanketweed & Algae Control (Aquaclear) for a proactive approach to preventing and controlling algae and blanket weed in your pond. Its long-lasting blue dye and harmless formulation make it an excellent choice for maintaining a clear and aesthetically pleasing pond environment. Rely on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: BAO BIO + 500g
description_text:
BaoBio+ is a highly concentrated bacteria preparation with a bacterial count of more than 100 million per gram. The BaoBio+ bacteria strains organically reduce harmful Pseudonomas and Aeromonas strains within 4 weeks by up to 99.9%.

  • Reduces pathogens by up to 99.9%
  • Completely organic
  • Reduces organic waste

Technical Data 
Weight (kg) 0.5
Brand Air-Aqua
Advice max. Volume koi pond (m3) 200
Dosage 2.5 g/m3

name: Cloverleaf Dechlor Answer 250ml
description_text:
‚ 

For use in new ponds and water changes.

Use 10ml per 182litres (40gal).

Conditions tap water, removes impurities that are present in drinking water that can be harmful to fish and the aquatic environment use when filling a new pond with water or after water changes should also be used when topping up to replace water that has evaporated.

name: Cloverleaf Acriflavin 1ltr
description_text:
Cloverleaf Acriflavine Answer is a stronger treatment for use when being troubled by persistent problems of red wounds, open ulcers, blotches on the body and fin-rot.
Diseases and probable cause:
Damage - cause: Accidental when breeding, attacked by heron, sudden disturbanceSymptoms: reddish scrapping on body of fish, large open wound, missing scales.
Fin and tail rot - cause: BacteriaSymptoms: blood streaking and rotting away reddish tips to effected area.
Cloverleaf Acriflavine Answer Dosage:
Use 10ml per 364 litres (80 Gallons).
Can be applied up to 3 times as a course of treatment leaving 7 days between each application. Switch off UVC for 5 days after each applictaion.
Use above 10‚°c and below 30‚°c.
Do not repeat a course of treatment for 10 days or use other medications.

name: ACTIVE BIO-MIX 20ltr (Jerry Can)
description_text:
Active Mix Bio is a combination of substances including photosynthetic and lactic acid bacteria, yeasts and
trace elements. This combination has a positive impact on the natural balance and biological life resulting in
a perfect equilibrium. It also strongly promotes the biological conversion of ammonia and nitrites into nitrates.
The fact that this mix is already in an activated state means it has a direct and rapid effect on your pond.
Photosynthetic bacteria:
Produce substances that promote the growth of micro-organisms,
especially heterotrophic bacteria. During conversion they produce valuable
substances from organic waste and harmful matter in the water.
Photosynthetic bacteria also compete with algae for nutrients and
sunlight. In the case of algae, light is absorbed by chlorophyll, just like with
regular plants. However, with photosynthetic bacteria, photosynthesis takes
place directly in the cell. Consequently, this provides the additional benefit of
reducing algae growth.
Lactic acid bacteria:
Suppresses pathogenic germs and other harmful micro-organisms and
promote a rapid degradation of organic material (waste substances).
Other additives in the Active Mix Bio (e.g. yeasts and trace elements) suppress
harmful fungi and produce bioactive compounds. Effect of Active Mix Bio Biological
processes occur everywhere, breaking down waste products and turning them into
useful substances. The degradation and composition can take place in different
ways depending on circumstances. By adding Active Mix Bio, the useful bacteria
receive a powerful boost at the expense of harmful micro-organisms. Active Bio Mix
supports the nitrifying effects of the biological filter as well as the degradation of
organic materials.

name: Kusuri PRO-100 5ltr
description_text:
A number of dangerous pathogenic strains of bacteria, like Aeromonas, Pseudomonas and E.coli, can cause catastrophic fish losses in ponds through infections of wounds and ulcers.
Pro-100 is an effective preventative water treatment that does not involve anti-biotics, disinfectants or any other type of chemical products.
Pro-100 is not a direct cure for wounds and ulcers but will assist in the natural therapeutic recovery from disease and infection.
Pro-100 will reduce free-living pathogenic bacteria. It cannot directly reduce bacteria that have already penetrated skin tissue. The multiplying colonies of beneficial bacteria out compete harmful strains of pathogens, by consuming the nutrients that the pathogens require to survive and develop. Effectively, Pro-100 reduces the numbers of pathogens by occupying their living space and starving them out of the food chain and replaces the harmful bacteria with beneficial bacteria.

Use 5ml per 1000 ltr (220 gallons) add daily for one week. Then reduce to 10ml per 4550 ltr (1000 gallons) every 7 days thereafter.

Below 15°C double the dose to 20ml per treatment every five days.

Start up dose (daily for 7 days):

500ml treats 22,000 gallons

1 litre treats 44,000 gallons

5 litre treats 220,000 gallons

maintainance dose (once per 7 days above 15°C):

500ml treats 50,000 gallons

1 litre treats 100,000 gallons

5 litre treats 500,000 gallons

Shake well before use. Add correct dose directly to the pond in an area of a good water flow.

name: NT Labs Satus 250ml
description_text:
NT Labs Satus quickly establishes & enhances aquarium biofilters. It accelerates the maturing of aquarium systems, and prevents ‘new tank syndrome’, therefore making new aquariums safe for fish.

Satus is a valuable new tool for all fish keepers as it quickly establishes and accelerates the maturing of aquarium systems.

Satus contains our innovative ‘Satus organism’ capable of rapidly removing ammonia without relying on the traditional, slower nitrifying cycle. Working under both aerobic and anaerobic conditions, our ‘Satus organism’ can also degrade organic compounds which bacteria cannot. It has a higher metabolic rate that provides faster breakdown of organic wastes to prevent them building up in the aquarium.  

Satus also contains a concentrated unique blend of heterotrophic and autotrophic organisms, including aerobic and anaerobic nitrifying bacteria that rapidly remove harmful ammonia and nitrite by converting them into nitrates, and will not produce hydrogen sulphide. This process prevents toxic ‘new tank syndrome’ providing a safer environment for your fish. Satus is harmless to all aquatic species including plants and cannot be overdosed. 

How to use:

  • Shake bottle thoroughly before use.
  • Turn off UV/ozone. Turn back on 2 hours after adding Satus.
  • Calculate aquarium volume litres (length x width x depth (in cm)/1000). 
  • See label for full dose rate 
  • If dosage is maintained for the full 7 days, fish and other aquatic species can be added to the aquarium at any point. 
  • Add monthly for improved biofilter function and add; when introducing new fish, after each filter clean/water change, after treating the aquarium with medication. 
  • Keep out of reach of children. Store in a cool dry place. 
  • Satus cannot be used as a replacement for an aquarium filter but should be used alongside one.

name: NT Labs Optimus 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Optimus is a concentrated aquarium water dechlorinator & conditioner, it detoxifies ammonia, nitrite, nitrate, & heavy metals.

Optimus is a highly concentrated dechlorinator and conditioner that makes tap water safe for fish. Optimus removes chlorine, chloramine, halogens, and detoxifies heavy metals found in tap water.

Optimus detoxifies ammonia, nitrite, and nitrate into a safe form that can be removed by the biofilter. Always test your aquarium water using NT Labs Test Kits.

Optimus should be used when setting up a new aquarium and during every water change.

How to use:

  • Shake bottle thoroughly before use.
  • When adding to a new aquarium, calculate aquarium volume litres (length x width x depth (in cm)/1000). 
  • See label for full dose rate 
  • Dose for the full aquarium volume and add directly to the aquarium. 
  • During a water change, add the appropriate dose directly to the new water before adding to the aquarium.
  • A half dose should be used when water temperature is +30°C and chlorine and ammonia levels are low. The normal dose can be doubled for water containing exceptionally high chloramine. Optimus can be used up to 5 times normal dosage to detoxify nitrite in an emergency. 
  • Sulphur odour is normal.

name: Takazumi Kein-Pro 2.5ltr
description_text:
KIEN PRO is a complementary food for Koi.
It compensates for important nutrients that are lost in the production process of granular feed.
The improved KIEN PRO helps to aid your fish during digestion.

The unique mix of herbs, amino acids, fatty acids, vitamins, carbohydratesand minerals/trace elements and probiotics and enzymes will allow all organs involved in digestion to function in harmony.

Also, the beneficial microorganisms will eagerly use the enzymes and herbs that are in the KIEN PRO.

name: NT Labs GH - Minerals Up 1.5kg
description_text:
NT Labs GH Minerals Up - General Hardness (GH) Booster

When to Use: NT Labs GH Minerals Up is recommended when there is a need to increase the general hardness (GH) of pond water. General hardness minerals, including calcium and magnesium, play crucial roles in various biological functions such as fish growth, metabolism, and other physiological processes. GH levels can decrease over time due to factors like rainwater influx, soft tap water, and biological processes that consume these minerals.

How to Use:

  1. Dosage Preparation:

    • Dissolve the powder in a bucket of pond water before adding it to the pond.

  2. Application:

    • Add the dissolved solution to the pond.

  3. Safety Measures:

    • Keep the product out of the reach of children.
    • Wash hands thoroughly after handling fish and the product.

  4. GH Monitoring:

    • Utilize NT Labs Hardness Test Kit to measure the GH of the pond water.

  5. Optimal GH Level:

    • Maintain the GH above 8 °dH for optimal water quality.

  6. Tap Water Adjustment:

    • GH – Minerals Up can be used to supplement general hardness in cases where tap water is naturally low in hardness minerals.

Note:

  • Regular monitoring of GH levels is advisable to ensure that the hardness remains within the desired range for the well-being of pond life.

Always follow the recommended dosage and guidelines for optimal results.

name: NT Labs Mediclay 20kg
description_text:
NT Labs Mediclay - Water Re-Mineralization and Clarity

When to Use: NT Labs Mediclay is recommended for use as a weekly additive to re-mineralize pond water. It helps control the buildup of organic waste, bacteria, and pollutants that can lead to bacterial infections and compromised fish health. Additionally, Mediclay stimulates the biological system in favor of beneficial bacteria, aiding in the reduction of algae. It contributes to water clarity, providing a better environment for observing fish.

How to Use:

  1. Mixing the Dose:

    • Mix the required dose of Mediclay in a clean bucket or watering can with pond water.

  2. Application:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly over the surface of the pond or at a filter outlet to ensure even distribution.

  3. Water Clarification:

    • For water clarification, it's best to apply Mediclay via the pump or venturi so that it is rapidly mixed with the returning water.

  4. Conjunction with Other Treatments:

    • Use in conjunction with other NT Labs water treatments, but allow a 48-hour gap after applying an NT Labs Medication before using Mediclay.

  5. Year-Round Use:

    • Mediclay can be used at any time of the year regardless of water temperature.
    • It does not alter the water pH.

Do Not:

  • Use within 48 hours of applying another medication.

Note:

  • Regular use of Mediclay contributes to maintaining water quality and clarity in the pond.

name: NT Labs Tap Water Chlorine Remover 250ml
description_text:
NT Labs Tap Water Chlorine Remover (Aquasure)

When to use? Use Aquasure, also known as Tap Water Chlorine Remover, when topping up your pond or when initially filling it with tap water. Domestic tap water can contain harmful substances, with chlorine and chloramine being among the most dangerous to pond life. Aquasure is designed to safely neutralize chlorine, chloramine, other halogens, and heavy metals that can be toxic to fish. Additionally, it can help reduce shock during transportation.

How to use:

  1. Shake the bottle well before use.
  2. Mix the correct dose in a clean bucket of pond water.
  3. Pour the mixture evenly around the pond before topping up or filling it with tap water.

Usage Tips:

  • If refilling with a hosepipe, use enough Aquasure to treat the entire volume of the pond.
  • You can also use Aquasure on smaller volumes of water before adding them to your pond.

Warning:

  • For use in ornamental ponds only.
  • This product cannot be overdosed.

Aquasure ensures that tap water added to your pond is safe for fish and helps maintain a healthy and stress-free environment.

name: NT Labs Sludge Remover 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Sludge Remover (Sludgeclear)

When to use? Use Sludgeclear, also known as Sludge Remover, when there is a noticeable build-up of sludge on the bottom of the pond. This product is particularly effective when used after the addition of algae and blanket weed treatments. Sludgeclear is a blend of enzymes and bacteria designed to digest organic material, promoting a cleaner pond and filter. By reducing sludge, it creates fewer opportunities for disease-causing organisms to hide. Sludgeclear also supports and encourages the activity of biological filter bacteria.

How to use:

  1. Shake the bottle well before use.
  2. Mix the correct dose in a clean bucket of pond water.
  3. Pour the mixture evenly around the pond.

Usage Tips:

  • Use Sludgeclear regularly during the pond season to help maintain a clean filter and pond.
  • Ensure that you follow the recommended dosage for optimal results.

Regular use of Sludgeclear can contribute to a healthier pond environment by breaking down organic material and reducing the risk of disease.

name: NT Labs Foam Control 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Foam Control - Also Known as Foamclear

When to Use: If you observe a build-up of unsightly foam and froth on the surface of your pond, this could be due to an excess of protein in the water. NT Labs Foam Control, or Foamclear, is the solution to break down the froth, allowing proper gas exchange between the water and air and helping to maintain the correct pH.

How to Use:

  1. Shake Well:

    • Ensure the bottle is well-shaken before use.

  2. Dosage Preparation:

    • Mix the correct dose in a clean bucket of pond water.

  3. Even Distribution:

    • Gradually add the mixed solution, pouring it evenly around the pond.

  4. Persistent Foam:

    • If there is a constant presence of a lot of foam, take the following steps:
      • Check the efficiency of the biological filtration system using NT Labs Ammonia and Nitrite Test Kits.
      • Reduce the amount of food fed to the fish.
      • Add Mature to boost the activity of the filter system.
      • Perform a partial water change.

Note: Regular monitoring of your pond's water quality is essential to address the root cause of persistent foam.

Choose NT Labs Foam Control (Foamclear) for a clear and well-maintained pond, ensuring optimal gas exchange and pH balance.

name: NT Labs Duckweed Control 500ml
description_text:
NT Labs Duckweed Control – Your Solution for Nuisance Plant Build-Up in Ponds

When to Use: NT Labs Duckweed Control, also known as Cristalclear, is the ideal solution when you're dealing with a build-up of nuisance plants like duckweed in your pond. Cristalclear not only removes duckweed but also targets phosphate, the nutrient responsible for the rapid spread of these nuisance plants.

How to Use:

  1. Shake Well:

    • Ensure the product is well-shaken before use for effective application.

  2. Remove Excess Duckweed (Optional):

    • For best results, rake off as much duckweed as possible before treatment.

  3. Mix Full Dose in Bucket:

    • In a clean bucket of pond water, mix the full dose of Cristalclear.

  4. Evenly Distribute Around Pond:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly around the pond.

  5. Double Dose (if necessary):

    • If the water is severely affected, the dose can safely be doubled without risk to fish.

  6. Weekly Application for First 2 Weeks:

    • Add to the pond every week for the first two weeks during the growing season.

  7. Biweekly Application Thereafter:

    • After the initial two weeks, apply every other week during the growing season for continued control.

  8. Minimum 6 Months Use:

    • Use Cristalclear for a minimum of six months to achieve optimum benefits.

Note:

  • Cristalclear not only targets duckweed but also helps control phosphate levels, preventing the rapid spread of nuisance plants.

Trust NT Labs Duckweed Control (Cristalclear) for effective management of nuisance plants in your pond. Follow the provided instructions for a successful treatment experience. Count on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: NT Labs Chlor-GO 2.5 litre
description_text:
NT Labs Chlor-Go – Your Essential Solution for Making Tap Water Safe for Fish

When to Use: NT Labs Chlor-Go is a must-have when filling or topping up your pond with tap water. Tap water contains chemicals such as chlorine, chloramine, and heavy metals that can be harmful to fish. These need to be neutralized for the water to be safe for your fish. Chlor-Go is the rapid and effective solution to turn tap water into fish-safe pond water. It should be used for all water changes and can also be employed during the transport of new or existing fish stocks.

How to Use:

  1. Dosage for Pond Volume:

    • Use the appropriate dosage for the entire volume of your pond when regularly topping up an established pond.

  2. Mix in Small Volume of Water:

    • Add the recommended dosage to a small volume of water and mix thoroughly.

  3. Split Dosage During Top-Up:

    • Add half of the mixed solution before filling the pond and the other half during the top-up process.

Usage Tips:

  • Regularly use Chlor-Go when topping up your pond to maintain fish-safe water.
  • Consider using Chlor-Go during the transport of new or existing fish stocks to ensure their well-being.

Trust NT Labs Chlor-Go for rapid and reliable neutralization of harmful chemicals in tap water, making it safe for your pond fish. Its easy-to-use formulation ensures that your water changes are stress-free for your fish. Count on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: NT Labs Blanketweed balance 4kg
description_text:
NT Labs Blanket Balance – Your Solution for Controlling Blanketweed Growth and Re-Balancing Water Quality

When to Use: NT Labs Blanket Balance is designed to be administered when your pond starts to show signs of blanketweed growth. This specialized treatment utilizes natural ingredients to re-mineralize and re-balance the water quality, addressing the conditions that contribute to blanketweed development. Blanket Balance is completely safe for fish, plants, and biological filtration systems.

How to Use:

  1. Ensure Pond Aeration and Water Quality:

    • Before administering the dose, ensure your pond is well-aerated, and test the water quality using NT Labs Test Kits for accurate measurements.

  2. Mix Correct Dose:

    • In a clean bucket or watering can filled with pond water, mix the required dose of Blanket Balance according to the provided instructions.

  3. Pour Evenly Around Pond:

    • Pour the mixed solution evenly around the pond and on watercourses or falls for comprehensive coverage.

  4. Cloud Formation is Normal:

    • After application, a cloud may form in the water column. This is a normal and safe reaction that will clear after a few hours.

  5. Post-Treatment Recommendation:

    • One week after dosing Blanketweed Balance, it is recommended to use Sludge Remover (Sludgeclear) to aid in the digestion of organic material in the pond.

Warning:

  • Do not use Blanketweed Balance when dissolved oxygen may be low (e.g., at daybreak, in hot, humid, or thundery weather, or within three hours of feeding).
  • Avoid use if your water quality is poor or fish are showing symptoms of ill health.
  • UV filters can be left on during application.
  • Wash your hands after use.

Trust NT Labs Blanket Balance to effectively control blanketweed growth and re-balance water quality in your pond. Its natural ingredients and safe formulation make it an excellent choice for maintaining a healthy pond environment. Count on NT Labs for reliable solutions in pond water management.

name: Mr Koizumi - Clay 86 2.5kg
description_text:
Clay 86 is ultra-finely ground (smaller than 50 microns), ensuring optimal solution and dispersion in the water without residue. Due to its extremely fine milling, Clay 86 is not filtered out by drum filters. Immediately after addition, it binds toxins, heavy metals, and other impurities, effectively removing them from the water.

The use of Clay 86 goes beyond just improving water clarity; it plays a crucial role in promoting the health and well-being of the fish. This contributes to a healthy environment for your fish, resulting in more vibrant colors and increased activity. The natural minerals in Clay 86 provide the ecosystem with necessary nutrients.

Instructions for Optimal Use:

• Dissolve 10 to 20 grams weekly per 1000 liters of pond water

• First mix with a limited amount of water in a bucket, then spread evenly along the edges of the pond

• The water will initially become cloudy but will clear within 24 hours, depending on the filtration and amount of organic material in the pond

Clay 86 can also be added directly to feed (1 – 5%) to improve digestion and nutrient absorption.

Composition:

SiO₂: 54.78%

Al₂O₃: 18.52%

Fe₂O₃: 7.35%

CaO: 2.41%

MgO: 3.35%

K₂O: 1.18%

Na₂O: 0.79%

P₂O₅: 0.09%

TiO₂: 0.48%

LOI: 10.37%

 

Typical Mineralogy:Montmorillonite: 86%

Quartz: 6%

Calcite: 1%

Mica: 6%

Plagioclase: 1%

 

Caution:

• Keep cool, dry and out of reach of children

• Clay 86 is exclusively intended for use in ponds and aquariums

• Do not inhale when opening; do not open the product in a closed space

• Close the packaging well after use to prevent moisture absorption

name: Mr Koizumi - Green Control 2.5kg
description_text:
Green Control is an entirely natural water improver that makes anti-algae products in many cases redundant.

Green Control enriches the water with valuable minerals, improves the health of fish, stimulates the appetite and improves colour development.

Green Control increases oxygen levels an can also be used below 10C.

Green Control is free from algicide, biocide, zincoxide and copper compounds,

Green Control is also suitable for swimming ponds and is harmless to humans and animals.

**Green Control is phosphate free**

Dosage 25g per 1000 litres: initial use: 2 times a month (every 2 weeks).

name: Mr Koizumi - GH/KH+ 2.5kg
description_text:
Mr  Koizumi GH/KH+ is a combination of essential minerals that together ensure the correct mineral balance in the pond. The quality of the mineral balance is extremely important for the growth of aquatic plants and the development of micro organisms. Organic life along with its components survives on these minerals. Organic processes stagnate in soft water. It is essential for stable and healthy pond life to add these essential minerals. 

Effect of GH/KH+ contains a broad range of minerals and as a result raises the general hardness (GH) and carbonate hardness (KH). It is important to maintain these values at the right levels (GH between 8° and 12°; KH between 6° and 11°) in order to prevent acidification of the water. GH/KH+ is a completely natural product without supplements. It is completely organic and harmless to all pond life, even with

threefold overdosing. It is also suitable for ponds used for swimming and harmless to people and animals. 

Dosage: 100 grams per 1000 liters. Raises the GH by 3° to 5° and the KH by 2° to 3°.  

Spread The GH/KH+ in the water or first mix it in a bucket and distribute evenly over the pond.

name: NT Labs - Ammonia Test kit
description_text:
NT Labs Ammonia Test Kit – Your Key to Maintaining a Healthy Aquatic Environment

Understanding Ammonia: Fish waste, uneaten food, and decaying organic matter contribute to the production of ammonia, the primary waste product in aquariums. While invisible to the naked eye, ammonia poses a significant threat to fish health. Fortunately, beneficial bacteria in the filter break down ammonia into less toxic nitrite, ensuring a safer environment for your aquatic companions.

Correct Ammonia Level: Zero tolerance for ammonia is crucial. Maintain a level of zero mg/l (ppm) at all times to safeguard the well-being of your fish.

What to Do if Ammonia Levels Are Wrong:

  • If the level is 0.2 mg/l (ppm), add a filter booster like Filter Bugs.
  • For levels above 0.2 mg/l (ppm), conduct a substantial water change. Change 25% of the volume for 0.5 – 1.0 mg/l (ppm) ammonia and 50% for higher levels. Introduce Zeolite to the filter compartment to remove ammonia.
  • In case of any ammonia detection, check other critical water quality parameters such as pH, KH, and nitrite.

How to Use:

  1. Ensure the test tube is clean.
  2. Collect a 5 ml water sample into the test tube.
  3. Add 5 drops of Ammonia 1, 5 drops of Ammonia 2, and 5 drops of Ammonia 3.
  4. Replace the test tube cap, shake thoroughly, and wait for 10 minutes.
  5. Compare the color of the sample to the provided color scale. A yellow color indicates zero ammonia, while any hint of green signals the presence of ammonia in the water.

Additional Information:

  • The test kit reports concentration in terms of nitrogen (NH3-N) for compatibility with reported safe concentrations applicable to fish and plants.
  • If interested in the ionic concentration, multiply the result by 1.21 (NH3-N).

Trust NT Labs Ammonia Test Kit to accurately assess ammonia levels, empowering you to maintain a pristine and healthy aquatic environment for your beloved fish. Keep your water quality in check and ensure the well-being of your aquatic companions with NT Labs.

name: NT Labs - Nitrite Test kit
description_text:
NT Labs Nitrite Test – Safeguarding Your Aquarium Against Harmful Nitrite Levels

Understanding Nitrite: Nitrite is a byproduct of beneficial filtration bacteria breaking down harmful ammonia excreted by fish. Although not as toxic as ammonia, nitrite poses a serious threat to fish health. It is invisible to the naked eye and is broken down into nitrate, which is less harmful to fish.

What is the Correct Nitrite Level? Zero tolerance for nitrite is crucial in aquariums. Maintain a level of zero mg/L (ppm) at all times to ensure the well-being of your fish.

What to Do if the Nitrite Level is Wrong:

  • For 0.25 – 0.5 mg/l (ppm) of nitrite, add Filter Bugs.
  • If nitrite levels exceed this range, conduct a substantial water change. Change 25% of the water volume for 1 mg/l (ppm) nitrite and 50% for higher levels.
  • Zeolite can remove ammonia (and thus nitrite) from the water and can be recharged.
  • If nitrite is detected, check other vital water quality parameters, especially pH and ammonia.

How to Use the Nitrite Test:

  1. Ensure the test tube is clean.
  2. Collect a 5 ml water sample into the test tube.
  3. Add 5 drops of the Nitrite reagent.
  4. Replace the test tube cap and shake thoroughly.
  5. Wait for 2 minutes, then compare the color of the sample to the provided color scale. A colorless sample indicates zero nitrite, while any hint of pink signals the presence of nitrite in the water. Disregard any color forming after the two minutes.

Additional Information:

  • The test kit reports concentration in terms of nitrogen (NO2-N) for compatibility with reported safe concentrations for fish and plants.
  • If interested in the ionic concentration, multiply the result by 3.29 (NO2-N).

Trust NT Labs Nitrite Test to provide accurate measurements, allowing you to take prompt action against harmful nitrite levels. Keep your fish healthy and thriving by monitoring and managing nitrite effectively. Rely on NT Labs for reliable water testing solutions.

name: NT Labs - Pond Water MINI Test kit
description_text:
NT Labs Pond Water Mini Test Kit – Compact Excellence for Essential Pond Water Testing

When to Use: For the conscientious pond keeper, the NT Labs Pond Water Mini Test Kit is your compact companion for ensuring excellent water quality. This mini kit is designed to test three crucial water parameters: pH, Nitrite, and Ammonia. Regular testing is essential to maintain the well-being of your fish and the overall health of your pond.

Understanding Ammonia: Ammonia, excreted by fish as a waste product, is extremely toxic. This kit helps you monitor ammonia levels, crucial for fish health, as it is broken down into less harmful nitrite by beneficial bacteria in the pond filter.

Understanding Nitrite: Nitrite is produced as beneficial bacteria break down harmful ammonia in the pond and filters. While less toxic than ammonia, elevated nitrite levels can still harm fish. Nitrite is further broken down into nitrate, which is less harmful to fish.

Understanding pH: The pH test in this kit measures the acidity or alkalinity of pond water on a scale from 0 to 14. It provides insights into whether your water is acidic, alkaline, or neutral. This information is vital for maintaining a suitable environment for aquatic life.

How to Perform the Tests: This mini kit includes a comprehensive instruction leaflet that guides you through each parameter, their optimal ranges, and recommended actions if readings are outside those ranges. It's designed to be user-friendly, ensuring accurate and hassle-free testing.

Reported Concentrations for Compatibility: The test kit reports concentrations in terms of nitrogen (NH3-N) or (NO2-N), aligning with reported safe concentrations for fish and plants. If you're interested in the ionic concentration of the measured parameter, simply multiply the result by 1.21 (NH3-N) or 3.29 (NO2-N).

Key Features:

  • Compact design for testing pH, Nitrite, and Ammonia.
  • Essential for maintaining excellent water quality in ponds.
  • User-friendly instructions for accurate testing.
  • Compatible concentrations for fish and plants.

Trust the NT Labs Pond Water Mini Test Kit for efficient and reliable testing of crucial parameters in your pond. Keep your fish and pond environment healthy with regular monitoring using this compact yet powerful kit. Choose NT Labs for precision in pond water testing.

name: NT Labs - Hardness Test kit
description_text:
NT Labs Hardness Test Kit – Comprehensive Monitoring for Your Pond's Water Quality

Understanding KH (Carbonate Hardness): KH, also known as "total alkalinity" or "carbonate hardness," measures the buffering capacity of your pond water. This capacity indicates how well the water can resist changes in pH.

What is the Correct KH Level? Maintain a minimum KH level of 4 dKH at all times, with a more desirable range between 6 and 8 dKH. This test kit measures KH in dKH, where one dKH equals 17.8 ppm as CaCO3.

What to Do if the KH Level is Wrong:

  • Check the KH level of your tap water. Regular water changes are sufficient if the tap water KH is above 6 dKH.
  • If tap water KH is below 6 dKH, use a KH buffer like KH – Buffer Up to maintain a suitable level in your pond.

How to Use the KH Test:

  1. Ensure the test tube is clean.
  2. Collect a 5 ml water sample into the test tube.
  3. Add one drop of the KH reagent, mix, and observe the pale blue color.
  4. Continue adding drops, one by one, mixing between drops until the color changes from blue to yellow.
  5. The number of drops needed for the color change equals the KH value in dKH.

Understanding GH (General Hardness): GH measures the total minerals dissolved in water, with water hardness ranging from 'soft' to 'hard' based on mineral content. Hard water can lead to limescale buildup.

What is the Correct GH Level? For pond fish, the ideal GH level is between 8 and 12 dGH. This test kit measures GH in dGH, where one degree equals 17.8 ppm as CaCO3.

What to Do if the GH Level is Wrong:

  • Test the GH of your tap water. If too hard, consider using alternative water sources like reverse osmosis water to lower GH.
  • In ponds, where rainwater may lower GH over time, use GH & Minerals Up to boost GH to a suitable level.

How to Use the GH Test:

  1. Ensure the test tube is clean.
  2. Collect a 5 ml water sample into the test tube.
  3. Add two drops of GH A reagent, mix, and observe the dark pink color.
  4. Add one drop at a time of GH B reagent, counting the drops between mixing until the solution changes from pink to blue.
  5. The number of drops needed for the color change equals the GH value in dGH.

Maintain the balance of KH and GH in your pond with NT Labs Hardness Test Kit, ensuring optimal water quality and a healthy environment for your fish. Trust NT Labs for precise water testing solutions.

name: NT Labs - Phosphate Test Kit
description_text:
NT Labs Phosphate Test – Ensuring Optimal Phosphate Levels for a Healthy Aquatic Environment

Understanding Phosphate: Phosphate is a crucial nutrient found in fish food, aiding in growth, bone formation, and various biological processes. While essential for life, excess phosphate, not utilized by fish, can be excreted as waste or generated by the breakdown of organic matter. Elevated phosphate levels are often associated with the growth of nuisance algae, and while beneficial in small quantities, higher concentrations can disrupt the mineral balance within fish.

Why Test for Phosphate? Testing for phosphate is essential to monitor and control its concentration in the water, as increased levels contribute to nuisance algae growth. While low levels are generally safe for fish, monitoring phosphate prevents potential interference with the mineral balance in fish at higher concentrations.

What is the Correct Phosphate Level? The ideal phosphate concentration should be kept as close to zero as possible. Trace amounts between 0 and 0.25 mg/L PO4-P are sufficient for the healthy growth of higher plants.

What to Do if the Phosphate Level is Wrong:

  • Regular partial water changes with dechlorinated tap water can help maintain low phosphate levels.
  • Check the phosphate concentration in tap water to avoid accidental introduction.
  • Use Duckweed Control, a liquid solution, to bind phosphate and prevent excessive levels.

How to Perform the Test:

  1. Ensure the test tube is clean.
  2. Collect a 5 ml sample of pond water into the test tube.
  3. Add 5 drops of the phosphate reagent, place the cap on the tube, and mix gently for a few seconds.
  4. Wait for 5 minutes for the test to develop.
  5. Remove the cap and look down through the test tube to determine the color.
  6. Compare the color to the provided color chart to determine the phosphate concentration.

Maintain the optimal phosphate levels in your aquatic environment with NT Labs Phosphate Test. Regular monitoring and appropriate action will ensure a healthy and balanced ecosystem for your aquatic companions. Choose NT Labs for accurate and reliable water testing solutions.

name: NT Labs - Broad PH Test kit
description_text:
NT Labs Broad pH Test Kit – Precision for Your Pond's pH Balance

Understanding pH: The NT Labs Broad Range pH Test Kit is specially designed for testing water within the pH range of 6 – 9, covering the pH spectrum commonly observed in ponds. With enhanced precision offering 0.5 unit determination, this test ensures accurate monitoring of your pond's pH levels.

Correct pH Level: While there is no universally correct pH level, different fish species have their preferred pH ranges. Generally, the ideal pH value falls between 7 and 8, but it's essential to consider the specific requirements of the fish you own. Always inquire about the preferred water conditions when purchasing fish from your local aquatic retailer.

What to Do if the pH Level is Off:

  • If adjustments are necessary, make changes slowly to avoid shocking the fish. Limit pH adjustments to no more than 0.5 units every 2 days.
  • Conduct substantial water changes if your tap water has a suitable pH to correct dangerous pH levels.
  • Check the KH (carbonate hardness) of the pond. Use pH adjusters like KH - Buffer Up to raise pH caused by soft or aged water.
  • For fish in soft, acid water, consider using bogwood to gently lower the pH and soften the water.

How to Use:

  1. Ensure the test tube is clean.
  2. Collect a 5ml water sample into the test tube.
  3. Add 5 drops of the pH reagent, replace the test tube cap, and shake thoroughly.
  4. Compare the color of your sample to the provided color scale for an accurate pH reading.

Maintain the optimal pH balance in your pond with the NT Labs Broad pH Test Kit. With improved precision and a broad testing range, this kit empowers you to create the perfect environment for your fish. Trust NT Labs for reliable water testing solutions, ensuring the health and happiness of your aquatic companions.

name: NT Labs - Nitrate Test kit
description_text:
NT Labs Nitrate Test – Monitoring Your Pond's Nitrate Levels for a Balanced Environment

Understanding Nitrate: Nitrate is a byproduct of beneficial bacteria breaking down fish waste products (ammonia and nitrite) in water and filters. While not typically toxic to fish, excessively high nitrate levels (>100mg/l) can lead to growth issues.

What is the Correct Nitrate Level? The ideal nitrate level depends on factors like tap water quality, fish population, and feeding habits. Although nitrate is not typically harmful, high levels can promote algal growth. Ideally, a nitrate level of zero signifies a balance between fish waste and nutrient absorption by plant life, including algae.

What to Do if the Nitrate Level is Wrong: Maintaining a constant zero nitrate level can be challenging. Regular water changes are key to diluting nitrate buildup. Pay attention to your tap water's nitrate level, as it contributes to the overall pond nitrate.

How to Use the Nitrate Test:

  1. Ensure the test tube is clean.
  2. Collect a 5 ml water sample into the test tube.
  3. In well-lit conditions, turn Nitrate-1 upside down and shake vigorously until there is no sediment on the bottom.
  4. Add 6 drops of Nitrate-1 and 6 drops of Nitrate-2. Replace the test tube cap and shake thoroughly.
  5. Wait for 10 minutes, then compare the sample color to the provided color scale. A colorless sample indicates zero nitrate, while any hint of pink signals nitrate presence.

Additional Information:

  • The test kit reports concentration in terms of nitrogen (NO3-N) for compatibility with reported safe concentrations for fish and plants.
  • If interested in the ionic concentration, multiply the result by 4.43 (NO3-N).

Trust NT Labs Nitrate Test to accurately measure nitrate levels, providing you with the information needed to maintain a balanced pond environment. Keep your fish and plants healthy by monitoring and managing nitrate levels effectively. Choose NT Labs for reliable water testing solutions.

name: Aqua Master P160 PRO Kit  (PH, EC, PPM, TDS, Temp) inc case
description_text:
pH, EC, TDS, PPM, Temp meter P160 Pro

The Aqua Master Combo Pen P160 Pro features a modern and robust housing. The major advantage of this model is its analogue EC calibration. This means that the calibration solution does not need to have a temperature of exactly 25ºC.

Calibration takes place without any deviations. EC buffer solutions are extremely sensitive to temperature. However, this does not apply to pH. You can easily replace the electrode should it be worn or damaged. This model comes in a robust case, including pH 4.01, pH 7.00 and EC 1413 buffer solutions, allowing you to calibrate the meter at a later time.

The Combo Pen P160 Pro is ideal for measuring the pH, EC, PPM, TDS, and temperature of liquid plant nutrition and water in swimming pools, Jacuzzis and ponds. The user-friendly buttons can be used to effortlessly switch between the parameters. The meter is delivered fully calibrated and includes batteries.

How does the meter work?

  1. Remove the protective cover.
  2. Gently clean the electrode with distilled water and dry it off.
  3. Press the On/off button to start the meter.
  4. Insert the meter upright into the solution up to the edge and stir gently. Wait a few seconds for the correct value to appear on the display.
  5. Press the Temp/CAL button, to switch between Celsius and Fahrenheit.
  6. Press the PH/EC button to switch between pH and EC.
  7. Make sure the meter is in EC mode to switch between EC, TDS and PPM. Press and hold the PH/EC button for at least 5 seconds to switch parameters.
  8. Rinse the electrode with water after use and press the On/off button to turn off the meter.

Our electrodes are designed for dry storage. Therefore, storage in liquid is not required for the electrode.

This package contains:

  • 1 x Aqua Master Combo Pen P160 Pro
  • 1 x Storage box
  • 1 x Buffer solution pH 7.00 25ml
  • 1 x Buffer solution pH 4.01 25ml
  • 1 x Buffer solution 1413 25ml
  • 1 x Screwdriver for calibration
  • 1 x User manual (NL – EN – DE)

name: PH600 PH Pen
description_text:
PH600 pen type/dip meter for testing the pH level of your aquarium water, your koi carp pond water, and of course those critical pH levels needed on hydroponic plant systems.

 

Detailed specification:

  • Range : 0.0 to 14.0 pH
  • Resolution: .1 pH
  • Accuracy: ±0.1 pH
  • Calibration: manual 1 point
  • Environment: 0 to 50°C / 32 to 122°F; max RH 95%
  • Battery type /life: 3 x 1.5v, alkaline / 700 hours of use
  • Dimensions / weight: 150 x 30 x 24 mm / 85 g

This is a simple pen type meter supplied brand new in a plastic box complete with a calibration adjusting screw driver.

This test meter does require the sensor to be dipped in storage solution/water for 40mins prior to use, (as do all pH meters).

A pH meter is very different from a TDS/EC meter and does require the use of a storage solution to maintain the efficiency of the ph electrode that is in the tip of the device. Also it is important that the device is calibrated regularly with calibration solution. We do recommend that you calibrate your meter close to the range you wish to use it in, for most customers this will be at 7.0 pH, but it is pointless calibrating at 4.0 then wishing the meter to be accurate at 7.0 pH.

name: Sugar Valley Oxilife OX2 set (with installation set deluxe)
description_text: THE TREATMENT WHICH ADAPTS TO YOUR NEEDS<br data-mce-fragment="1"/>- The combined low-salinity hydrolysis and electrolysis unit offers optimal cleaning with minimal chlorine production<br data-mce-fragment="1"/>- The system’s action provides perfect disinfection of the water using a minimum of salt<br data-mce-fragment="1"/><br data-mce-fragment="1"/>In water with a low conductivity (from 500 mS) OH-, ozone, hydrogen peroxide and oxygen will be automatically produced for the disinfection of water. Only 1,5gr NaCl/l is needed.<br data-mce-fragment="1"/><br data-mce-fragment="1"/>The principle of disinfection is based on the separation of H and O atoms of the molecule of water (H20) in order to generate active substances with a strong potential for disinfection (stronger than chlorine!). <br data-mce-fragment="1"/><br data-mce-fragment="1"/>Hydrolysis: Water (H2O) consists of two parts 2Hydrogen (H2) and 1 part of Oxygen (O). Hydrolysis means "splitting water". When electric tension is going through the water, the chemical connection will be broken. The negative loaded oxygen (or ions) will move to the positive electrode (anode) With the following electrochemical reaction: Electric tension + 2 H2O = 2 H2 + O2<br data-mce-fragment="1"/><br data-mce-fragment="1"/>With Hydrolysis there are also other chemical reactions that take place. It will also produce specific ions that can oxidize and do additional disinfecting work. The table down below shows the different Redox potential values of the elements that are produced by hydrolysis in compare with other oxidizing elements.<br data-mce-fragment="1"/><br data-mce-fragment="1"/>The hydrolysis unit has Ø63mm connections.<br data-mce-fragment="1"/>(Not suitable in combination with EPDM foil)

name: Set Elite Connect 100 LS (with installation set premium / sensors + dose)
description_text: The Astral Elite Connect LS is a low salt hydrolyse system designed and produced by Fluidra’s Idegis. It can do disinfection with 1-2 grams of salt per liter.<br data-mce-fragment="1"/><br data-mce-fragment="1"/>ADVANTAGES:<br data-mce-fragment="1"/>- Full colour touchscreen<br data-mce-fragment="1"/>- salinity and temperature monitoring<br data-mce-fragment="1"/>- Scalable control functions with Plug-in modules for pH, ORP, free chlorine (PPM) and VSP Pump<br data-mce-fragment="1"/>- Embedded Poolstation capabilities (Domotica system for control with smartphone/tablet/computer)<br data-mce-fragment="1"/>- 4 digital inputs / 4 digital outputs (relay)<br data-mce-fragment="1"/>- Dual communication ports (Ethernet and Modbus)<br data-mce-fragment="1"/>- Embedded UV-C lamp control <br data-mce-fragment="1"/><br data-mce-fragment="1"/>Low salt electrolysis/hydrolysis has become a very popular way of disinfection in the recent years for both pool as natural swimming ponds/biopools. The big advantage with hydrolysis is that strong oxidants are made from water by splitting it in O and H atoms. These O and H atoms can then form these oxidation products: O (atomic oxygen), O2 (oxygen), O3 (ozone), H2O2 (hydrogen peroxide) and •OH (radical hydroxide). These disinfectants are as powerful or more powerful than chlorine (see table) but do not produce any harmful by-products (like chloramines for example). After reacting with an organic compound they will fall back to water. At salt levels of 1,5 - 2 g/l it also produces a small amount of chlorine that has a residual effect in pools. For natural swimming ponds a maximum salt level of 1 g/l is recommended when chlorine is not desired. (Not suitable in combination with EPDM foil)

name: AquaForte Dosatech Dosage pump (inc hose, suction/injection nipples)
description_text:
New and improved version of the very popular dosage pump! Now with very user-friendly 3-button operation. Very easy to program. Can now also be used as 'standard' dosage pump thanks to the external control function. The dosage pump then doses continuously as long as 230V is supplied. This allows the Dosatech to also be used as pH dosing pump with pool controllers, for example.

A big advantage of small daily dosages of living bacterial products (like Microbe-Lift Clean & Clear) compared to bigger monthly dosages is the so called ‘Yakult/Actimel effect’. With larger monthly dosages the bacteria that don’t find food will die. With small daily dosages more than 30 different species of living bacteria will enter the pond looking for food. The Dosatech can be used for dosing any liquid product like anti blanket weed products, phosphate binders, Ph+/Ph-products, etc. The neoprene hose makes it possible to add various types of solutions to the water of your pond.

- 3-button operation and programming
- Dosage up to 24 runs per day (max. 7,2 liter per day)
- Dosage from 0 to 600 seconds per dosage (0,5 ml/second)
- Continuous dosing possible with external control function
- Easy to install and to maintain
- Compact design
- Easy to combine with other installations
- Suction and injection nipples supplied (3/8" male threaded)

name: Oase Biotec Screenmatic2 90000
description_text:
The flow-through filter BioTec ScreenMatic² 90000 supplements the BioTec ScreenMatic² product range (40000, 60000, 140000) with an intermediate size (788 x 590 x 645 mm). Guarantees an excellent cleaning result for ponds up to 45m³ with fish stock. The inlet and outlet (DN110) are on one side for easy handling. Long service life thanks to automatic coarse dirt separation before entering the filter. The filter belt cleans itself automatically. Also as a complete set with AquaMax Eco Premium 20000 and Bitron C 110W. 

2 year warranty + 1 year demand warranty.

  • Significantly less maintenance is required, thanks to coarse debris extraction
  • More convenience, thanks to automatically driven self-cleaning of the belt filter. Adjustable cleaning sensor controls the belt run, depending on the degree of pollution. incl. LED function check
  • Cleaning of filter sponges directly in the filter, without removal
  • Sludge drain with slide valve for removing debris from the filter system
  • Different filter media for optimal development of filter bacteria
  • Use of the PhosLess filter media tubes as needed for string algae reduction (optional accessory)
  • Optimally matched to OASE AquaMax Eco filter pumps
  • Direct connection possibility for Bitron C and Eco UVC clarifiers
  • Reinforced strap material for an extended service life
  • Double-sealed engine for an extended service life
  • Water distributor without danger of clogging: Distributes the water uniformly on the belt filter
  • Sludge basket with greater volume and simplified handling
  • Rubberized separating lip for outstanding separation result
  • Free brush for occasional cleaning of the belt filter
  • Manual belt run now possible via button
  • Highly effective flow-through filter for ponds up to 90.0 m3

name: OASE AquaMax Eco Expert 27000 12V EGC
description_text:
For the AquaMax Eco Expert 27000 / 12 V filter and stream pump, feeding large filter systems for koi and swimming ponds as well as demanding streams and waterfalls is child's play. It offers high flow rates but works absolutely economically. The performance of the energy-efficient powerhouse can also be smartly controlled, individually regulated and queried using the InScenio FM-Master EGC or EGC Controller as an accessory. And in a safe 12V version - ideal for swimming ponds and natural pools. The filter and stream pump also copes well with salt water. Coarse dirt particles with a grain size of up to 11 mm are reliably transported into the filter, with high efficiency. The housing is made of robust, durable stainless steel - can be set up dipped or dry. The patented filter and stream pump is frost-proof down to -20 °C and runs exceptionally quietly - ideal for use in a pump chamber.

name: OASE AquaMax Eco Titanium 81000
description_text:
The AquaMax Eco Titanium is an energy-efficient gravity filter pump for large gravity filter systems - especially for koi ponds.
The flow-optimized hydraulics ensure excellent efficiency, and the robust pump housing ensures stability - ideal for use in a pump chamber and extremely durable and reliable thanks to high-quality materials. The patented "Environmental Function Control" (EFC by OASE) reliably protects against dry running and blocking, and the patented "Seasonal Flow Control" (SFC) regulates water quantity and delivery height intelligently and environmentally consciously, so that via the FM Master EGC, EGC controller or With Easy Control, energy savings of up to 30% are possible. The network-compatible power pack can also cope with salt water and is also suitable for control via home network or cloud in conjunction with the InScenio FM Master EGC product range.

  • Innovative, energy-efficient gravity filter pump for large bodies of water, even with koi stock
  • Flow-optimized hydraulics help to achieve an outstanding level of efficiency
  • Robust pump housing made of cast stainless steel with large base for added stability – ideal for installation in a pump chamber
  • Rotor shaft and bearings made from high-quality SIC ceramics for optimal reliability and longevity
  • Ideal for installation in a pump chamber
  • Protection against running dry and blocking through Environmental Function Control (EFC by OASE)
  • Patented "Seasonal Flow Control" (SFC) for the smart and environmentally conscious regulation of the flow rate and delivery head: FM Master, Garden Controller or OASE Control can also save up to 30% more energy
  • Using optional accessories, when the SFC function is enabled, an extra 30% can be saved in energy
  • MADE IN GERMANY: precise and reliable German engineering skills at a particularly high quality level
  • System requirements: A Garden Controller Home/Cloud or InScenio FM-Master Home/Cloud is required to use the OASE Control functions.
  • Suitable for submersed or dry use – even in sea water
  • Handles coarse debris particles up to 6 mm in size



  • FOR THE LARGEST PONDS: Innovative, energy-efficient gravity filter pump for large bodies of water, even with koi stock
  • ENERGY EFFICIENCY: Flow-optimized hydraulics help achieve an outstanding level of efficiency
  • DURABLE: The rotor shaft and bearings are made of high-performance ceramic (silicon carbide or SIC ceramic) – for optimum reliability and longevity
  • IDEAL: Ideal for set-up in a pump vault
  • SFC FUNCTION: Switch on via optional accessories and save up to 30% energy on top
  • FOR UNIVERSAL USE: Suitable for submerged use or use in dry conditions – also suitable for saltwater
  • SUPER ROBUST: Pump housing made of stainless steel
  • MADE IN GERMANY: Precise and reliable engineering skills at a particularly high level of quality
  • APP CONTROL​: Simply download the OASE Control app (App Store or Play Store), register and get started
  • SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: A Garden Controller Home, Cloud or InScenio FM-Master Home, Cloud is required to use the OASE Control functions

name: NT Labs Pond Lab Test Kit
description_text:
NT Labs Pond Lab Multi-Test

The NT Labs Pond Lab Multi-Test kit is a comprehensive tool for testing key parameters in your pond. It includes tests for ammonia, nitrite, nitrate, pH, GH, and KH, providing up to 200 tests in total. The liquid drop tests use a dropper bottle to ensure consistent drop size. The kit comes with full instructions, test tubes, an integrated test tube rack, and color-coded stickers for easy organization.

Parameters Tested:

  1. Ammonia (NH3-N): Measures the concentration of ammonia in the form of nitrogen.
  2. Nitrite (NO2-N): Measures the concentration of nitrite in the form of nitrogen.
  3. Nitrate (NO3-N): Measures the concentration of nitrate in the form of nitrogen.
  4. pH: Measures the acidity or alkalinity of the water.
  5. GH (General Hardness): Measures the concentration of calcium and magnesium ions.
  6. KH (Carbonate Hardness): Measures the concentration of carbonate and bicarbonate ions.

How to Use:

  1. Add pond water to the test tube.
  2. Follow the provided instructions to add the corresponding drops for each test.
  3. Count the number of drops required for the reaction.
  4. Compare the color change to the reference chart.

Additional Information:

  • Results are reported in terms of nitrogen concentration (NH3-N, NO2-N, NO3-N).
  • For ionic concentration, multiply results by 1.21 (NH3-N), 3.29 (NO2-N), or 4.43 (NO3-N).

Note: This multi-test kit allows pond owners to regularly monitor crucial water parameters for optimal pond health. The provided instructions and organization aids make the testing process straightforward and reliable.

name: Tancho Ginrin Showa
description_text:
The finest Japanese Koi fish for sale in the UK. We specialize in providing high-quality Koi fish that are sure to impress. Our collection of Koi for sale includes a wide range of colours and patterns, making it easy to find the perfect fish for your pond or water garden.

**These Koi are from our recent buying trip and will arrive in the UK early in the New year**
*They will be available to view towards the end on Jan 2025*

*Please note* All of our koi are kept in ponds with a temperature of between 17 and 19 degrees, when you purchase a Koi the price Includes us keeping it until the spring and ambient temperature gets warm enough for you to take it.

If you have any questions regarding any of the Koi please do not hesitate to contact us.

*Please note* All of our koi are kept in ponds with a temperature of between 17 and 19 degrees, when you purchase a Koi the price Includes us keeping it until the spring and ambient temperature gets warm enough for you to take it.

If you have any questions regarding any of the Koi please do not hesitate to contact us

name: Wholesale Koi - BATCH-005
description_text:
**These fish are currently in 16.5 degrees**

*Important* - Please read before you purchase these fish-

  • If you purchase these fish you will receive the exact ones shown in the video.
  • You must be able to take delivery within 1-week (deliveries are on Wednesdays and Fridays).
  • The Koi must go into a good environment that is of a similar temperature to where they are coming from (temperature detailed in the description).
  • All fish sold have been through an extensive quarantine cycle in our bio-secure unit. However, as with transferring any fish, correct measures should be taken to ensure they settle in well (parasite scrapes etc.).
  • The delivery is included in the price but is only available for mainland UK addresses (*restrictions may apply to some areas)
